 27990                                  ;============================================================================
 27991                                  ; PATH2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 27992                                  ;============================================================================
 27993                                  ; 02/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27994                                  
 27995                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27996                                  ;   SEARCH, when given a pathname, attempts to find a file with
 27997                                  ; one of the following extensions: .com, .exe, .bat (highest to
 27998                                  ; lowest priority). Where conflicts arise, the extension with
 27999                                  ; the highest priority is favored.
 28000                                  ; ENTRY:
 28001                                  ;   DX		--	pointer to null-terminated pathname
 28002                                  ;   fbuf	--	dma buffer for findfirst/next
 28003                                  ; EXIT:
 28004                                  ;   AX		--	8)  file found with .com extension
 28005                                  ;			4)  file found with .exe extension
 28006                                  ;			2)  file found with .bat extension
 28007                                  ;			0)  no such file to be found
 28008                                  ;   (if AX is non-zero:)
 28009                                  ;   [search_best]	identical to AX
 28010                                  ;   [search_best_buf]	null-terminated filename
 28011                                  ; NOTES:
 28012                                  ;   1) Requires caller to have allocated a dma buffer and executed a setdma.
 28013                                  ;---------------
 28014                                  ; CONSTANTS:
 28015                                  ;---------------
 28016                                  SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND	EQU	0
 28017                                  SEARCH_COM		EQU	8
 28018                                  SEARCH_EXE		EQU	4
 28019                                  SEARCH_BAT		EQU	2
 28020                                  FNAME_LEN		EQU	8
 28021                                  FNAME_MAX_LEN		EQU	13
 28022                                  DOT			EQU	'.'
 28023                                  WILDCHAR		EQU	'?'
 28024                                  
 28025                                  
 28026                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 28027                                  
 28028                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 26D6h
 28029                                  
 28030                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 28031                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:34C9h
 28032                                  
 28033                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 28034                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:3A73h
 28035                                  
 28036                                  	; 04/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 28037                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:3927h
 28038                                  PSEARCH:
 28039 00003782 51                      	push	cx
 28040 00003783 52                      	push	dx
 28041 00003784 57                      	push	di
 28042 00003785 56                      	push	si
 28043                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 28044 00003786 52                      	push	dx		; check drivespec (save pname ptr)
 28045 00003787 89D7                    	mov	di,dx		; working copy of pathname
 28046 00003789 BE[5AA4]                	mov	si,search_curdir_buf
 28047 0000378C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; zero means current drive
 28048 0000378E 807D013A                	cmp	byte [di+1],':'	; is there a drive spec?
 28049 00003792 7508                    	jne	short SEARCH_DIR_CHECK
 28050 00003794 8A15                    	mov	dl,[di]		; get the drive byte
 28051 00003796 80E2DF                  	and	dl,0DFh ; ~20h	; uppercase the sucker
 28052 00003799 80EA40                  	sub	dl,'@' ; 40h	; and convert to drive number
 28053                                  SEARCH_DIR_CHECK:
 28054 0000379C B80047                  	mov	ax,Current_Dir*256 ; 4700h
 28055 0000379F CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - GET CURRENT DIRECTORY
 28056                                  			; DL = drive (0=default,1=A,etc.)
 28057                                  			; DS:SI	points to 64-byte buffer area
 28058 000037A1 5A                      	pop	dx		; directory? If we can't we'll
 28059 000037A2 724C                    	jc	short SEARCH_INVALID_DRIVE
 28060                                  				; assume it's a bad drive...
 28061 000037A4 B91300                  	mov	cx,search_attr	; 13h
 28062                                  				; filetypes to search for
 28063 000037A7 B8004E                  	mov	ax,Find_First*256 ; 4E00h ; request first match, if any
 28064 000037AA CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - FIND FIRST	ASCIZ (FINDFIRST)
 28065                                  			; CX = search attributes
 28066                                  			; DS:DX	-> ASCIZ filespec
 28067                                  			; (drive,path, and wildcards allowed)
 28068 000037AC 7249                    	jc	short SEARCH_NO_FILE
 28069 000037AE C606[4CA4]00            	mov	byte [search_best],SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 0
 28070 000037B3 C606[4DA4]00            	mov	byte [search_best_buf],ANULL
 28071                                  				; 0 ; nothing's been found, yet
 28072                                  SEARCH_LOOP:
 28073 000037B8 E84300                  	call	SEARCH_FTYPE	; determine if .com, &c...
 28074 000037BB 3A06[4CA4]              	cmp	al,[search_best]
 28075                                  				; better than what we've found so far?
 28076 000037BF 7E13                    	jle	short SEARCH_NEXT
 28077                                  				; no, look for another
 28078 000037C1 A2[4CA4]                	mov	[search_best],al
 28079                                  				; found something... save its code
 28080                                  	;mov	si,offset TRANGROUP:fbuf.find_buf_pname
 28081                                  	;mov	si,FBUF_PNAME
 28082 000037C4 BE[38A4]                	mov	si,FBUF+FIND_BUF.PNAME ; FBUF+30
 28083 000037C7 BF[4DA4]                	mov	di,search_best_buf
 28084 000037CA B90D00                  	mov	cx,FNAME_MAX_LEN ; 13
 28085 000037CD FC                      	cld
 28086 000037CE F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; save complete pathname representation
 28087 000037D0 3C08                    	cmp	al,SEARCH_COM	; 8
 28088                                  				; have we found the best of all?
 28089 000037D2 740A                    	je	short SEARCH_DONE
 28090                                  SEARCH_NEXT:			; keep on looking
 28091 000037D4 B91300                  	mov	cx,search_attr ; 13h
 28092 000037D7 B8004F                  	mov	ax,Find_Next*256 ; 4F00h ; next match
 28093 000037DA CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - FIND NEXT ASCIZ (FINDNEXT)
 28094                                  			; [DTA]	= data block from
 28095                                  			; last AH = 4Eh/4Fh call
 28096 000037DC 73DA                    	jnc	short SEARCH_LOOP
 28097                                  SEARCH_DONE:			; it's all over with...
 28098 000037DE A0[4CA4]                	mov	al,[search_best]
 28099                                  				; pick best to return with
 28100                                  	; 18/03/2023
 28101                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28102 000037E1 803E[069F]01            	cmp	byte [ext_entered],1
 28103                                  				;AN005; Did user request a specific ext?
 28104 000037E6 7411                    	je	short SEARCH_EXIT
 28105                                  				;AN005; no - exit
 28106 000037E8 A0[069F]                	mov	al,[ext_entered]
 28107                                  				;AN005; yes - get the real file type back
 28108 000037EB A2[4CA4]                	mov	[search_best],al
 28109                                  				;AN005; save the real file type
 28110                                  	;
 28111 000037EE EB09                    	jmp	short SEARCH_EXIT
 28112                                  
 28113                                  SEARCH_INVALID_DRIVE:		; Tell the user path/drive
 28114 000037F0 8B16[9AA4]              	mov	dx,[search_error]
 28115                                  				; appropriate error message
 28116 000037F4 E8311C                  	call	std_printf	; and pretend no file found
 28117                                  
 28118                                  SEARCH_NO_FILE:			; couldn't find a match
 28119                                  	;mov	ax,SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 0
 28120                                  	; 18/03/2023
 28121 000037F7 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 28122                                  SEARCH_EXIT:
 28123                                  	;popf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 28124 000037F9 5E                      	pop	si
 28125 000037FA 5F                      	pop	di
 28126 000037FB 5A                      	pop	dx
 28127 000037FC 59                      	pop	cx
 28128 000037FD C3                      	retn
 28129                                  
 28130                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 28131                                  
 28132                                  ; SEARCH_FTYPE determines the type of a file by examining its extension.
 28133                                  ;
 28134                                  ; ENTRY:
 28135                                  ;   fbuf    --	dma buffer containing filename
 28136                                  ; EXIT:
 28137                                  ;   AX	    --	file code, as given in search header
 28138                                  ; NOTE(S):
 28139                                  ;   *	Implicit assumption that NULL == search_file_not_found
 28140                                  
 28141                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 28142                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 28143                                  
 28144                                  	; 04/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 28145                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:3927h
 28146                                  SEARCH_FTYPE:
 28147 000037FE 57                      	push	di
 28148 000037FF 56                      	push	si
 28149                                  	;mov	ax,ANULL ; 0	; find the end of the filename
 28150                                  	; 18/02/2023
 28151 00003800 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; ax = 0		
 28152                                  	;mov	di,offset TRANGROUP:fbuf.find_buf_pname
 28153                                  	;mov	di,FBUF_PNAME
 28154 00003802 BF[38A4]                	mov	di,FBUF+FIND_BUF.PNAME ; FBUF+1Eh
 28155 00003805 B90D00                  	mov	cx,FNAME_MAX_LEN ; 13
 28156 00003808 FC                      	cld
 28157 00003809 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb		; search for the terminating null
 28158 0000380B 7535                    	jnz	short FTYPE_EXIT
 28159                                  				; weird... no null byte at end
 28160 0000380D 83EF05                  	sub	di,5		; . + E + X + T + NULL
 28161                                  
 28162                                  	; Compare .COM
 28163

 28222                                  
 28223                                  ; STRIP copies the source string (argv[0]) into the destination buffer,
 28224                                  ; replacing any extension with wildcards.
 28225                                  ;
 28226                                  ; ENTRY:
 28227                                  ;	BX	--	maximum length of destination buffer
 28228                                  ;	DS:SI	--	address of destination buffer
 28229                                  ;	argv[0] --	command name to be stripped
 28230                                  ; EXIT:
 28231                                  ;	CF	--	set if failure, clear if successful
 28232                                  ; NOTE(S):
 28233                                  
 28234                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 28235                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 28236                                  	; 08/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 28237                                  STRIP:
 28238 00003856 50                      	push	ax
 28239 00003857 53                      	push	bx
 28240 00003858 51                      	push	cx
 28241 00003859 52                      	push	dx
 28242 0000385A 57                      	push	di
 28243 0000385B 56                      	push	si
 28244                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 28245                                  		
 28246                                  	; 05/05/2023
 28247                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28248 0000385C C606[069F]01            	mov	byte [ext_entered],1
 28249                                  				;AN005; assume no extension on file name
 28250                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 28251                                  	;mov	dx,[ARG_ARGV]
 28252                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[0].argpointer
 28253                                  				; save pointer to beginning of argstring
 28254                                  	;mov	dx,[ARGV0_ARGPOINTER]
 28255 00003861 8B16[509F]              	mov	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argpointer]
 28256                                  	;mov	di,ds:arg.argv[0].argstartel
 28257                                  				; beginning of last pathname element
 28258                                  	;mov	di,[ARGV0_ARGSTARTEL] ; beginning of last pathname element
 28259 00003865 8B3E[539F]              	mov	di,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argstartel]
 28260 00003869 803D00                  	cmp	byte [di],0	; *STARTEL == NULL means no command
 28261 0000386C 743D                    	je	short STRIP_ERROR
 28262 0000386E 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx		; compute where end of argstring lies
 28263                                  	;add	cx,ds:arg.argv[0].arglen
 28264                                  	;add	cx,[ARGV0_ARGLEN]
 28265 00003870 030E[559F]              	add	cx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.arglen]
 28266 00003874 29F9                    	sub	cx,di		; and then find length of last element
 28267 00003876 41                      	inc	cx		; include null as well
 28268 00003877 B02E                    	mov	al,'.'
 28269                                  	;mov	al,DOT		; let's find the filetype extension
 28270 00003879 FC                      	cld
 28271 0000387A F2AE                    	repnz	scasb		; wind up pointing to either null or dot
 28272                                  
 28273                                  	; 18/03/2023
 28274                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28275 0000387C E307                    	jcxz	PROCESS_EXT	;AN005; if no extension found, just continue
 28276 0000387E B000                    	mov	al,0 ; 18/03/2023
 28277                                  	;mov	byte [ext_entered],0
 28278 00003880 A2[069F]                	mov	[ext_entered],al
 28279                                  				;AN005; we found an extension
 28280                                  	;;mov	al,ANULL	;AN005; continue scanning until the
 28281                                  	;mov	al,0
 28282 00003883 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb		;AN005; end of line is reached.
 28283                                  PROCESS_EXT:
 28284                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 28285 00003885 89F9                    	mov	cx,di		; pointer to end of argstring yields
 28286 00003887 29D1                    	sub	cx,dx		; number of bytes to be copied
 28287 00003889 83EB04                  	sub	bx,4		; can argstring fit into dest. buffer?
 28288 0000388C 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx
 28289 0000388E 7F1B                    	jg	short STRIP_ERROR
 28290                                  				; if not, we must have a bad pathname
 28291 00003890 89F7                    	mov	di,si		; destination buffer
 28292 00003892 89D6                    	mov	si,dx		; source is beginning of pathname
 28293 00003894 FC                      	cld
 28294 00003895 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; SI=arg,DI=buffer,CX=argend-argbeg
 28295                                  
 28296                                  	; 18/03/2023
 28297                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28298 00003897 803E[069F]01            	cmp	byte [ext_entered],1
 28299                                  				;AN005; if an extension was entered
 28300 0000389C 750A                    	jne	short SKIP_WILDS ; cf = 1 ; 12/06/2023
 28301                                  				;AN005;    don't set up wildcard ext.
 28302                                  
 28303                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 28304 0000389E 4F                      	dec	di		; overwrite null or dot
 28305 0000389F AA                      	stosb			; with a dot
 28306 000038A0 B03F                    	mov	al,'?'
 28307                                  	;mov	al,WILDCHAR	; now add wildcards
 28308 000038A2 AA                      	stosb
 28309 000038A3 AA                      	stosb
 28310 000038A4 AA                      	stosb

 28312                                  	;mov	al,ANULL	; and a terminating null

 28315                                  	;popf	; ** ; 18/03/2023

 28318

 28331                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 28332                                  
 28333                                  ; SAVE_ARGS attempts to preserve the existing argv[]/argvcnt/argbuffer
 28334                                  ;
 28335                                  ; structure in newly allocated memory. The argv[] structure is found at the
 28336                                  ; beginning of this area. The caller indicates how much extra space is
 28337                                  ; needed in the resulting structure; Save_Args returns a segment number and
 28338                                  ; an offset into that area, indicating where the caller may preserve its own
 28339                                  ; data. Note that <argvcnt> can be found at <offset-2>.
 28340                                  ; ENTRY:
 28341                                  ;   BX	    --	size (in bytes) of extra area to allocate
 28342                                  ; EXIT:
 28343                                  ;   AX	    --	segment of new area.
 28344                                  ;   CF	    --	set if unable to save a copy.
 28345                                  ; NOTE(S):
 28346                                  ;   1)	The allocated area will be AT LEAST the size requested -- since
 28347                                  ;	the underlying MSDOS call, <alloc> returns an integral number of
 28348                                  ;	paragraphs.
 28349                                  ;   2)	It is an error if MSDOS can't allocate AT LEAST as much memory
 28350                                  ;	as the caller of Save_Args requests.
 28351                                  ;   3)	AX is undefined if CF indicates an error.
 28352                                  
 28353                                  	; 19/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 28354                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 28355                                  	; 09/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 28356                                  SAVE_ARGS:
 28357 000038B3 53                      	push	bx
 28358 000038B4 51                      	push	cx
 28359 000038B5 52                      	push	dx
 28360 000038B6 57                      	push	di
 28361 000038B7 56                      	push	si
 28362 000038B8 55                      	push	bp
 28363                                  	; 01/05/2023
 28364                                  	; 26/04/2023
 28365                                  	;pushf ; **
 28366                                  	;;add	bx,1363		; space for arg structure, round up
 28367                                  	; 09/08/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM
 28368                                  	;add	bx,1107 ; 1092+15
 28369 000038B9 81C35304                	add	bx,ARG_UNIT.SIZE+15 ; 1348+15
 28370 000038BD B104                    	mov	cl,4		; to paragraph size and convert
 28371 000038BF D3EB                    	shr	bx,cl		; size in bytes to size in paragraphs
 28372 000038C1 B80048                  	mov	ax,ALLOC*256 ; 4800h
 28373 000038C4 CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 28374                                  			; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 28375 000038C6 7241                    	jc	short SAVE_ERROR ; ***
 28376 000038C8 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax		; save segment id
 28377 000038CA 06                      	push	es		; save TRANGROUP address
 28378 000038CB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; switch to new memory segment
 28379                                  	; assume es:nothing
 28380                                  	;mov	cx,1348		; get back structure size
 28381 000038CD B94404                  	mov	cx,ARG_UNIT.SIZE ; 1092 ; 09/08/2024

 28383                                  	;mov	si,ARG_ARGV
 28384 000038D2 BE[509F]                	mov	si,ARG		; source is arg structure
 28385                                  	; 09/08/2024
 28386 000038D5 56                      	push	si
 28387 000038D6 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move that sucker!
 28388                                  	;mov	cx,arg.argvcnt 	; adjust argv pointers
 28389                                  	;mov	cx,[ARG_ARGVCNT]
 28390 000038D8 8B0E[10A2]              	mov	cx,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 28391 000038DC 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax		; base address for argv_calc
 28392                                  
 28393                                  ;	Bugbug:	What did they mean by this?
 28394                                  ;	Note that the replacement line produces exactly the same code.
 28395                                  ;;	mov	SI, OFFSET TRANGROUP:arg.argbuf - OFFSET arg_unit.argbuf
 28396                                  ;	mov	SI, OFFSET TRANGROUP:arg
 28397                                  
 28398                                  	;;mov	si,ARG_ARGV
 28399                                  	;mov	si,ARG
 28400                                  	; 09/08/2024
 28401 000038DE 5E                      	pop	si
 28402                                  SAVE_PTR_LOOP:
 28403 000038DF 49                      	dec	cx		; exhausted all args?
 28404 000038E0 7C24                    	jl	short SAVE_DONE
 28405 000038E2 89CB                    	mov	bx,cx		; get arg index and
 28406 000038E4 E8A7FC                  	call	argv_calc	; convert to a pointer
 28407                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[bx].argpointer
 28408                                  	;mov	dx,[ARG_ARGV+bx]
 28409 000038E7 8B97[509F]              	mov	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argpointer+bx]
 28410 000038EB 29F2                    	sub	dx,si		; adjust argpointer
 28411                                  	;mov	es:argv[BX].argpointer,dx
 28412                                  	;mov	[es:bx+ARGV_ELE.argpointer],dx ; mov [es:bx+0],dx
 28413 000038ED 268917                  	mov	[es:bx],dx
 28414                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[bx].argstartel
 28415                                  	;mov	dx,[ARGV0_ARGSTARTEL+bx]

 28417 000038F4 29F2                    	sub	dx,si		; and adjust argstartel

 28419                                  	;mov	[es:bx+3],dx
 28420 000038F6 26895703                	mov	[es:bx+ARGV_ELE.argstartel],dx
 28421                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[bx].arg_ocomptr
 28422                                  	;mov	dx,[ARGV0_OCOMPTR+bx]

 28431                                  	; assume es:nothing

 28436

 28441                                  ;	stc
 28442                                  ;	jmp	short SAVE_EXIT
 28443

 28445                                  	; 26/04/2023
 28446                                  	;popf ; **
 28447                                  	; 26/04/2023
 28448                                  	; cf = 0 ; *
 28449                                  	;clc
 28450                                  SAVE_EXIT:
 28451                                  SAVE_ERROR:	; 26/04/2023 (cf=1) ; ***
 28452 00003909 5D                      	pop	bp
 28453 0000390A 5E                      	pop	si
 28454 0000390B 5F                      	pop	di
 28455 0000390C 5A                      	pop	dx
 28456 0000390D 59                      	pop	cx
 28457 0000390E 5B                      	pop	bx

 29000                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 29001                                  
 29002                                  ; ****************************************************************
 29003                                  ; *
 29004                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 ON_OFF
 29005                                  ; *
 29006                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Parse the command line for an optional ON or
 29007                                  ; *		 OFF string for the BREAK, VERIFY, and ECHO
 29008                                  ; *		 routines.
 29009                                  ; *
 29010                                  ; * INPUT:	 command line at offset 81H
 29011                                  ; *		 PARSE_BREAK control block
 29012                                  ; *
 29013                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 If carry is clear
 29014                                  ; *		    If ON is found
 29015                                  ; *		       Zero flag set
 29016                                  ; *		    If OFF is found
 29017                                  ; *		       Zero flag clear
 29018                                  ; *		 If carry set
 29019                                  ; *		    If nothing on command line
 29020                                  ; *		       CL set to zero
 29021                                  ; *		    If error
 29022                                  ; *		       CL contains error value from parse
 29023                                  ; *
 29024                                  ; ****************************************************************
 29025                                  
 29026                                  	; 19/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 29027                                  ON_OFF:
 29028 00003AB6 BE8100                  	mov	si,81h
 29029                                  
 29030                                  	; 19/03/2023
 29031                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29032                                  	;call	SCANOFF		; scan off leading blanks & equal
 29033                                  	;cmp	al,0Dh		; are we at end of line?
 29034                                  	;je	short BAD_ONF	; yes, return error
 29035                                  	;lodsw
 29036                                  	;or	ax,2020h	; convert to lowercase
 29037                                  	;cmp	ax,6E6Fh ;'on'
 29038                                  	;je	short ON_CHECK
 29039                                  	;cmp	ax,666Fh ;'of'
 29040                                  	;jne	short BAD_ONF
 29041                                  	;lodsb
 29042                                  	;or	al,20h		; convert to lowercase		
 29043                                  	;cmp	al,66h	 ; 'f'
 29044                                  	;jne	short BAD_ONF	
 29045                                  	;or	al,66h ; or al,'f'
 29046                                  	;jmp	short OFF_CHECK
 29047                                  ;ON_CHECK:
 29048                                  	;xor	al,al
 29049                                  ;OFF_CHECK:
 29050                                  	;lahf
 29051                                  	;mov	bx,ax
 29052                                  	;call	SCANOFF		; scan off leading blanks & equal
 29053                                  	;cmp	al,0Dh		; are we at end of line?	
 29054                                  	;jne	short BAD_ONF	; no, return error
 29055                                  	;mov	ax,bx
 29056                                  	;sahf
 29057                                  	;clc
 29058                                  	;retn
 29059                                  
 29060                                  	; 19/03/2023
 29061                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29062                                  scan_on_off:			;AN032; scan off leading blanks & equal
 29063 00003AB9 AC                      	lodsb			;AN032; get a char
 29064                                  	;cmp	al,blank	;AN032; if whitespace
 29065 00003ABA 3C20                    	cmp	al,20h
 29066 00003ABC 74FB                    	je	short scan_on_off
 29067                                  				;AN032;    keep scanning
 29068 00003ABE 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab_chr	;AN032; if tab
 29069                                  	;cmp	al,09h
 29070 00003AC0 74F7                    	je	short scan_on_off
 29071                                  				;AN032;    keep scanning
 29072                                  	;cmp	al,equal_chr	;AN032; if equal char
 29073 00003AC2 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'=' ; 3Dh
 29074 00003AC4 7401                    	je	short parse_on_off
 29075                                  				;AN032;    start parsing
 29076 00003AC6 4E                      	dec	si		;AN032; if none of above - back up
 29077                                  
 29078                                  parse_on_off:			;AN032;    and start parsing
 29079 00003AC7 BF[1096]                	mov	di,PARSE_BREAK	;AN000; Get address of PARSE_BREAK
 29080 00003ACA 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		;AN000; clear cx,dx
 29081 00003ACC 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		;AN000;
 29082 00003ACE E89B0E                  	call	cmd_parse	;AC000; call parser
 29083                                  	;cmp	ax,-1 ; 0FFFFh

 29217                                  ; Do GET DATE system call and set up 3 character day of week in ARG_BUF
 29218                                  ; for output. Date will be returned in CX,DX.
 29219                                  
 29220                                  GetDate:
 29221 00003B23 BF[96A3]                	mov	di,Arg_Buf		;AC000; target for day of week
 29222 00003B26 B42A                    	mov	ah,Get_Date ;2Ah	;AC000; get current date
 29223 00003B28 CD21                    	int	21h			;AC000; Get date in CX:DX
 29224 00003B2A 98                      	cbw				;AC000;
 29225 00003B2B 51                      	push	cx			;AN000; save date returned in
 29226 00003B2C 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;  CX:DX
 29227 00003B2D 89C6                    	mov	si,ax
 29228 00003B2F D1E6                    	shl	si,1
 29229 00003B31 01C6                    	add	si,ax			; SI=AX*3
 29230 00003B33 89F1                    	mov	cx,si			;AN000; save si
 29231 00003B35 A1[C990]                	mov	ax,[WeekTab]		;AN000; get message number of weektab
 29232 00003B38 B6FF                    	mov	dh,util_msg_class ;0FFh	;AN000; this is a utility message
 29233 00003B3A 57                      	push	di			;AN000; save argument buffer
 29234 00003B3B E8CD19                  	call	TSYSGETMSG		;AN000; get the address of the message
 29235 00003B3E 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000; retrieve argument buffer
 29236 00003B3F 01CE                    	add	si,cx			;AC000; get day of week
 29237 00003B41 B90300                  	mov	cx,3
 29238 00003B44 F3A4                      	rep	movsb
 29239 00003B46 B000                    	mov	al,END_OF_LINE_OUT ; 0	;AC000; terminate the string
 29240 00003B48 AA                      	stosb
 29241 00003B49 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000; get back date
 29242 00003B4A 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 29243 00003B4B C3                      	retn

 29276                                  ; ****************************************************************
 29277                                  ; *
 29278                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 UPCONV     (ADDED BY EMG 4.00)
 29279                                  ; *
 29280                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 This routine returns the upper case equivalent of
 29281                                  ; *		 the character in AL from the file upper case table
 29282                                  ; *		 in DOS if character if above  ascii 128, else
 29283                                  ; *		 subtracts 20H if between "a" and "z".
 29284                                  ; *
 29285                                  ; * INPUT:	 AL	      char to be upper cased
 29286                                  ; *		 FUCASE_ADDR  set to the file upper case table
 29287                                  ; *
 29288                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 AL	      upper cased character
 29289                                  ; *
 29290                                  ; ****************************************************************
 29291                                  ;
 29292                                  ;assume	ds:trangroup				;AN000;
 29293                                  ;
 29294                                  ;upconv	proc	near				;AN000;
 29295                                  ;
 29296                                  ;	cmp	al,80h				;AN000;  see if char is > ascii 128
 29297                                  ;	jb	oth_fucase			;AN000;  no - upper case math
 29298                                  ;	sub	al,80h				;AN000;  only upper 128 chars in table
 29299                                  ;	push	ds				;AN000;
 29300                                  ;	push	bx				;AN000;
 29301                                  ;	mov	ds,[resseg]			;AN000;  get resident data segment
 29302                                  ;assume	ds:resgroup				;AN000;
 29303                                  ;	lds	bx,dword ptr FUCase_Addr+1	;AN000;  get table address
 29304                                  ;	add	bx,2				;AN000;  skip over first word
 29305                                  ;	xlat	ds:byte ptr [bx]		;AN000;  convert to upper case
 29306                                  ;	pop	bx				;AN000;
 29307                                  ;	pop	ds				;AN000;
 29308                                  ;assume	ds:trangroup				;AN000;
 29309                                  ;	jmp	short upconv_end		;AN000;  we finished - exit
 29310                                  ;
 29311                                  ;oth_fucase:					;AN000;
 29312                                  ;	cmp	al,small_a			;AC000; if between "a" and "z",
 29313                                  ;	jb	upconv_end			;AC000;     subtract 20h to get
 29314                                  ;	cmp	al,small_z			;AC000;    upper case equivalent.
 29315                                  ;	ja	upconv_end			;AC000;
 29316                                  ;	sub	al,20h				;AC000; Change lower-case to upper
 29317                                  ;
 29318                                  ;upconv_end:					;AN000;
 29319                                  ;	ret
 29320                                  ;
 29321                                  ;upconv	endp					;AN000;

 29341                                  ;***	MODIFICATION HISTORY
 29342                                  
 29343                                  ;11/01/83 EE  Added a few lines at the end of SCANSRC2 to get multiple
 29344                                  ;	     file concatenations (eg copy a.*+b.*+c.*) to work properly.
 29345                                  ;11/02/83 EE  Commented out the code in CPARSE which added drive designators
 29346                                  ;	     to tokens which begin with path characters so that PARSELINE
 29347                                  ;	     will work correctly.
 29348                                  ;11/04/83 EE  Commented out the code in CPARSE that considered paren's to be
 29349                                  ;	     individual tokens. That distinction is no longer needed for
 29350                                  ;	     FOR loop processing.
 29351                                  ;11/17/83 EE  CPARSE upper case conversion is now flag dependent. Flag is
 29352                                  ;	     1 when Cparse is called from COPY.
 29353                                  ;11/17/83 EE  Took out the comment chars around code described in 11/04/83
 29354                                  ;	     mod. It now is conditional on flag like previous mod.
 29355                                  ;11/21/83 NP  Added printf
 29356                                  ;12/09/83 EE  CPARSE changed to use CPYFLAG to determine when a colon should
 29357                                  ;	     be added to a token.
 29358                                  ;05/30/84 MZ  Initialize all copy variables. Fix confusion with destclosed
 29359                                  ;	     NOTE: DestHand is the destination handle. There are two
 29360                                  ;	     special values: -1 meaning destination was never opened and
 29361                                  ;	     0 which means that the destination has been openned and
 29362                                  ;	     closed.
 29363                                  ;06/01/84 MZ  Above reasoning totally specious. Returned things to normal
 29364                                  ;06/06/86 EG  Change to fix problem of source switches /a and /b getting
 29365                                  ;	     lost on large and multiple file (wildcard) copies.
 29366                                  ;06/09/86 EG  Change to use xnametrans call to verify that source and
 29367                                  ;	     destination are not equal.
 29368                                  ;
 29369                                  ;06/24/90 DO  If the destination of a file concatenation is the same as
 29370                                  ;	     first source file AND we run out of disk space before
 29371                                  ;	     completing the concatenation, restore the first source
 29372                                  ;	     file as best we can. See SeekEnd and CopErr. Bug #859.
 29373                                  ;
 29374                                  ;M031 SR 10/11/90  Bug #3069. Use deny write sharing mode to open files
 29375                                  ;		instead of compatibility mode. This gives lesser sharing
 29376                                  ;		violations when files are opened for read on a copy.

 30443                                  ;anyway write the ^Z out separately. The only drawback is that there is a
 30444                                  ;performance overhead on single ASCII file copies which now always involve
 30445                                  ;2 writes instead of 1 before. Is this really that important?

 31334                                  ;***	SetAsc - set Ascii, Binary, Inexact flags based on switches
 31335                                  ;
 31336                                  ;	Given switch vector in AX,
 31337                                  ;	  Set Ascii flag if /a is set
 31338                                  ;	  Clear Ascii flag if /b is set
 31339                                  ;	  Binary set if /b specified
 31340                                  ;	  Leave Ascii unchanged if neither or both are set
 31341                                  ; 	Also sets Inexact if Ascii is ever set. 
 31342                                  ;	AL = Ascii on exit, flags set
 31343                                  
 31344                                  	; 26/03/2023
 31345                                  SETASC:

 31349 00004523 50                      	push	ax

 31878                                  ;============================================================================
 31879                                  ; CPARSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 31880                                  ;============================================================================
 31881                                  ; 30/09/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31882                                  ; 28/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 31883                                  ; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 31884                                  ; 11/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 31885                                  
 31886                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------;
 31887                                  ; ENTRY:								;
 31888                                  ;	DS:SI	Points input buffer					;
 31889                                  ;	ES:DI	Points to the token buffer				;
 31890                                  ;	BL	Special delimiter for this call 			;
 31891                                  ;		    Always checked last 				;
 31892                                  ;		    set it to space if there is no special delimiter	;
 31893                                  ; EXIT: 								;
 31894                                  ;	DS:SI	Points to next char in the input buffer 		;
 31895                                  ;	ES:DI	Points to the token buffer				;
 31896                                  ;	[STARTEL] Points to start of last element of path in token	;
 31897                                  ;		points to a NUL for no element strings 'd:' 'd:/'       ;
 31898                                  ;	CX	Character count 					;
 31899                                  ;	BH	Condition Code						;
 31900                                  ;			Bit 1H of BH set if switch character		;
 31901                                  ;				Token buffer contains char after	;
 31902                                  ;				switch character			;
 31903                                  ;				BP has switch bits set (ORing only)	;
 31904                                  ;			Bit 2H of BH set if ? or * in token		;
 31905                                  ;				if * found element ? filled		;
 31906                                  ;			Bit 4H of BH set if path sep in token		;
 31907                                  ;			Bit 80H of BH set if the special delimiter	;
 31908                                  ;			   was skipped at the start of this token	;
 31909                                  ;		Token buffer always starts d: for non switch tokens	;
 31910                                  ;	CARRY SET							;
 31911                                  ;	    if CR on input						;
 31912                                  ;		token buffer not altered				;
 31913                                  ;									;
 31914                                  ;	DOES NOT RETURN ON BAD PATH, OR TRAILING SWITCH CHAR ERROR	;
 31915                                  ; MODIFIES:								;
 31916                                  ;	CX, SI, AX, BH, DX and the Carry Flag				;
 31917                                  ;									;
 31918                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------;
 31919                                  
 31920                                  ; Modifications to cparse: recognition of right and left parentheses
 31921                                  ; as integral tokens, and removal of automatic upper-case conversion code.
 31922                                  ;
 31923                                  ; Both modifications were installed in the course of adding a coherent
 31924                                  ; command-line parser to COMMAND.COM which builds a UNIX-style argv[]/argc
 31925                                  ; structure for command-line arguments. This parser relies on cparse to
 31926                                  ; recognize individual tokens.
 31927                                  ;
 31928                                  ; To process for-loops correctly, parentheses must therefore be
 31929                                  ; recognized as tokens. The upper-case conversion code was removed so
 31930                                  ; that commands (such as for and echo) would be able to use the "original"
 31931                                  ; text of the command line.
 31932                                  ;
 31933                                  ; Note also the modification to prevent the automatic conversion of colons
 31934                                  ; into spaces WITHIN THE SOURCE TEXT!
 31935                                  ;
 31936                                  ; Also note that BP is also clobbered if cparse recognizes any switches
 31937                                  ; on the command line.
 31938                                  ;
 31939                                  ; Alan L, OS/MSDOS				    14 August 1983
 31940                                  
 31941                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31942                                  
 31943                                  ; COMEQU.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 31944                                  
 31945                                  ;FSWITCH	EQU	8000h
 31946                                  ;FBADSWITCH	EQU	4000h
 31947                                  
 31948                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 3334h
 31949                                  
 31950                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 31951                                  		
 31952                                  	; 28/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 31953                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM (1991) Transient portion offset 431Fh
 31954                                  
 31955                                  	; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM

 32306                                  $P_Period	   equ	"."             ;AN020;
 32307                                  $P_Slash	   equ	"/"             ;AN020;

 32309                                  $P_Comma	   equ	","             ;AN000;
 32310                                  $P_Switch	   equ	"/"             ;AN000;
 32311                                  $P_Keyword	   equ	"="             ;AN000;
 32312                                  $P_Colon	   equ	":"             ;AN000;
 32313                                  $P_Plus 	   equ	"+"             ;AN000;

 32324                                  
 32325                                  $P_DOSTBL_File	   equ	4		;AN000; get file uppercase table

 32327                                  
 32328                                  $P_error_filespec  equ  1
 32329                                  
 32330                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32331                                  ; PARMS LABEL	BYTE
 32332                                  ;	DW	PARMSX
 32333                                  ;	DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 32334                                  ;	DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 32335                                  ;	DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 32336                                  ;				; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 32337                                  ;				; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 32338                                  ;	DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 32339                                  ;	DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 32340                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32341                                  
 32342                                  struc $P_PARMS_BLK			;AN000;
 32343 00000000 ????                    .$P_PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 32344 00000002 ??                      .$P_Num_Extra:	     resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 32345 00000003 ??                      .$P_Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 32346                                  endstruc 				;AN000;
 32347                                  
 32348                                  $P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 32349                                  $P_I_Use_Default   equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 32350                                  $P_I_Have_Delim    equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 32351                                  $P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 32352                                  
 32353                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32354                                  ; PARMSX LABEL	BYTE
 32355                                  ;	DB	minp,maxp		; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 32356                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 32357                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 32358                                  ;	DB	maxs			; # OF SWITCHES
 32359                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 32360                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 32361                                  ;	DB	maxk			; # OF KEYWORD
 32362                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 32363                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 32364                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32365                                  
 32366                                  struc $P_PARMSX_BLK			;AN000;
 32367 00000000 ??                      .$P_MinP: 	 resb 1	 ; 27/04/2023	;AN000; Minimum positional number
 32368 00000001 ??                      .$P_MaxP: 	 resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 32369 00000002 ??                      .$P_1st_Control: resb 1			;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 32370                                  endstruc				;AN000;
 32371                                  
 32372                                  ; 31/03/2023
 32373                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32374                                  ; << Control field definition >>
 32375                                  ;
 32376                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 32377                                  ;	   DW MATCH_FLAGS	; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 32378                                  ;				; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 32379                                  ;				; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 32380                                  ;				; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 32381                                  ;				; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32382                                  ;				; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32383                                  ;				; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32384                                  ;				; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32385                                  ;				; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32386                                  ;				; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32387                                  ;				; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 32388                                  ;				; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 32389                                  ;				; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 32390                                  ;	   DW FUNCTION_FLAGS
 32391                                  ;				; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 32392                                  ;				; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 32393                                  ;				; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 32394                                  ; (tm10)			; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 32395                                  ;
 32396                                  ;	   DW RESULT		; RESULT BUFFER
 32397                                  ;	   DW VALUES		; VALUE LISTS
 32398                                  ;	   DB nid		; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 32399                                  ;	   DB "...",0		; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 32400                                  ;	   :
 32401                                  ;
 32402                                  ;Note:
 32403                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 32404                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 32405                                  ;
 32406                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 32407                                  ;
 32408                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 32409                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 32410                                  ;
 32411                                  ;
 32412                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 32413                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 32414                                  ;
 32415                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 32416                                  ;
 32417                                  ;
 32418                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 32419                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 32420                                  ;
 32421                                  ;		DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 32422                                  ;		DB   '/A',0
 32423                                  ;
 32424                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 32425                                  ;
 32426                                  ;		DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 32427                                  ;		DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 32428                                  ;
 32429                                  ;
 32430                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 32431                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 32432                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 32433                                  ;
 32434                                  ;
 32435                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 32436                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 32437                                  ;
 32438                                  ;		DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 32439                                  ;		DB    '/A',0
 32440                                  ;		DB    '/B',0
 32441                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32442                                  
 32443                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 32444                                  
 32445                                  $P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 32446                                  $P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 32447                                  $P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 32448                                  $P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 32449                                  $P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 32450                                  $P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 32451                                  $P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 32452                                  $P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 32453                                  $P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 32454                                  $P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 32455                                  $P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 32456                                  $P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 32457                                  
 32458                                  ;**** Function flags
 32459                                  
 32460                                  $P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 32461                                  $P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 32462                                  $P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 32463                                  $P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 32464                                  
 32465                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 32466                                  struc $P_CONTROL_BLK
 32467 00000000 ????                    .$P_Match_Flag:	   resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 32468 00000002 ????                    .$P_Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 32469 00000004 ????                    .$P_Result_Buf:	   resw 1		;AN000; Result buffer address
 32470 00000006 ????                    .$P_Value_List:	   resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 32471 00000008 ??                      .$P_nid:	   resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 32472 00000009 ??                      .$P_KEYorSW:	   resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 32473                                  endstruc
 32474                                  
 32475                                  ; 31/03/2023
 32476                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32477                                  ;
 32478                                  ;VALUES LABEL	BYTE
 32479                                  ;	DB	nval		; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 32480                                  ;	+-
 32481                                  ;	| DB	nrng		; NUMBER OF RANGES
 32482                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 32483                                  ;	| +DD	X,Y		; RANGE OF VALUES
 32484                                  ;	|	:
 32485                                  ;	| DB	nnval		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 32486                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 32487                                  ;	| +DD	VALUE		; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 32488                                  ;	|	:
 32489                                  ;	| DB	nstrval 	; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 32490                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 32491                                  ;	| +DW	STRING		; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 32492                                  ;	+-	:
 32493                                  ;
 32494                                  ;STRING DB	"...",0		; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 32495                                  ;
 32496                                  ;Note:
 32497                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 32498                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 32499                                  ;
 32500                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 32501                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 32502                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 32503                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32504

 32506                                  $P_nval_Range	equ 1		;AN000; range list ID
 32507                                  $P_nval_Value	equ 2		;AN000; value list ID
 32508                                  $P_nval_String	equ 3		;AN000; string list ID
 32509                                  $P_Len_Range	equ 9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 32510                                  $P_Len_Value	equ 5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 32511                                  $P_Len_String	equ 3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)

 32515 00000000 ??                      .$P_NumofList:	resb 1		;AN000; number of following choice
 32516 00000001 ????                    .$P_Val_XL:	resw 1		;AN000; lower word of value
 32517 00000003 ????                    .$P_Val_XH:	resw 1		;AN000; higher word of value
 32518 00000005 ????                    .$P_Val_YL:	resw 1		;AN000; lower word of another value
 32519 00000007 ????                    .$P_Val_YH:	resw 1		;AN000; higher word of another value
 32520                                  endstruc
 32521                                  
 32522                                  ; 31/03/2023
 32523                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32524                                  ;
 32525                                  ;RESULT LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 32526                                  ;	DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 32527                                  ;					;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 32528                                  ;					;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 32529                                  ;					;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 32530                                  ;					;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 32531                                  ;					;	9=QUOTED STRING
 32532                                  ;	DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 32533                                  ;
 32534                                  ;	dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 32535                                  ;
 32536                                  ;       +-
 32537                                  ;       | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 32538                                  ;       | or
 32539                                  ;       |	DW i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 32540                                  ;       |				; (ES presents Segment address)
 32541                                  ;       | or
 32542                                  ;       |	DD STRING		; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 32543                                  ;       | or
 32544                                  ;       |	DB drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 32545                                  ;       | or
 32546                                  ;       |	DW YEAR	   		;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 32547                                  ;       |	DB MONTH   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 32548                                  ;       |	DB DATE	   ;(1-31)	 0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 32549                                  ;       | or
 32550                                  ;       |	DB HOUR	   ;(0-23)	 IN CASE OF TIME
 32551                                  ;       |	DB MINUTES    ;(0-59)	 Note: Range check is not performed .
 32552                                  ;       |	DB SECONDS    ;(0-59)	 0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 32553                                  ;       |	DB HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 32554                                  ;       +-
 32555                                  ;
 32556                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 32557                                  ;      list.
 32558                                  ;
 32559                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 32560                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it. For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 32561                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 32562                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32563

 32566 00000000 ??                      .$P_Type:	 resb 1		;AN000; Type returned

 32568 00000002 ????                    .$P_SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 32569 00000004 ????????                .$P_Picked_Val:	 resb 4		;AN000; value
 32570                                  endstruc
 32571                                  
 32572                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 32573                                  
 32574                                  $P_EOL		 equ 0		;AN000; End of line
 32575                                  $P_Number	 equ 1		;AN000; Number
 32576                                  $P_List_Idx	 equ 2		;AN000; List Index
 32577                                  $P_String	 equ 3		;AN000; String
 32578                                  $P_Complex	 equ 4		;AN000; Complex
 32579                                  $P_File_Spec	 equ 5		;AN000; File Spec
 32580                                  $P_Drive	 equ 6		;AN000; Drive
 32581                                  $P_Date_F	 equ 7		;AN000; Date
 32582                                  $P_Time_F	 equ 8		;AN000; Time
 32583                                  $P_Quoted_String equ 9		;AN000; Quoted String
 32584                                  
 32585                                  $P_No_Tag	 equ 0FFh	;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 32586                                  
 32587                                  ;**** Return code
 32588                                  ;
 32589                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 32590                                  
 32591                                  $P_No_Error	 equ 0		;AN000; No error
 32592                                  $P_Too_Many	 equ 1		;AN000; Too many operands
 32593                                  $P_Op_Missing	 equ 2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 32594                                  $P_Not_In_SW	 equ 3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 32595                                  $P_Not_In_Key	 equ 4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 32596                                  $P_Out_Of_Range  equ 6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 32597                                  $P_Not_In_Val	 equ 7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 32598                                  $P_Not_In_Str	 equ 8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 32599                                  $P_Syntax	 equ 9		;AN000; Syntax error
 32600                                  $P_RC_EOL	 equ -1		;AN000; End of command line
 32601                                  
 32602                                  ;in second byte of $P_Flags, referenced as $P_Flags2:
 32603                                  $P_equ		 equ 01h	;AN000; "=" packed in string buffet
 32604                                  $P_Neg		 equ 02h	;AN000; Negative value
 32605                                  $P_Time12	 equ 04h	;AN000; set when PM is specified
 32606                                  $P_Key_Cmp	 equ 08h	;AN000; set when keyword compare
 32607                                  $P_SW_Cmp	 equ 10h	;AN000; set when switch compare
 32608                                  $P_Extra	 equ 20h	;AN000; set when extra delimiter found
 32609                                  $P_SW		 equ 40h	;AN000; set when switch found (tm08)
 32610                                  $P_Signed	 equ 80h	;AN000; signed numeric specified
 32611

 32661                                  
 32662                                  ;***********************************************************************
 32663                                  ; SysParse;
 32664                                  ;
 32665                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 32666                                  ;
 32667                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 32668                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 32669                                  ;	  psdata_seg -> psdata.inc
 32670                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 32671                                  ;
 32672                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 32673                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 32674                                  ;		 is in DS.
 32675                                  ;
 32676                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 32677                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 32678                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 32679                                  ;
 32680                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 32681                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 32682                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 32683                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 32684                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 32685                                  ;
 32686                                  ; Use:	$P_Skip_Delim, $P_Chk_EOL, $P_Chk_Delim, $P_Chk_DBCS
 32687                                  ;	$P_Chk_Swtch, $P_Chk_Pos_Control, $P_Chk_Key_Control
 32688                                  ;	$P_Chk_Sw_Control, $P_Fill_Result
 32689                                  ;
 32690                                  ; Vars: $P_Ordinal(RW), $P_RC(RW), $P_SI_Save(RW), $P_DX(R), $P_Terminator(R)
 32691                                  ;	$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), $P_Flags(RW), $P_Found_SYNONYM(R), $P_Save_EOB(W)
 32692                                  ;

 32694                                  ;
 32695                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 32696                                  ;  4/28/87 : $P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 32697                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 32698                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 32699                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 32700                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 32701                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 32702                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 32703                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_FileSp_Char and $P_FileSP_Len are missing
 32704                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 32705                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 32706                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 32707                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add $P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 32708                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 32709                                  ;	     (tm08)
 32710                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 32711                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 32712                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag $P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 32713                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 32714                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 32715                                  ;	     in user's routines. $P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 32716                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 32717                                  ;					  (tm12)

 32719                                  ;					  (tm13)

 32721                                  ;					  (tm14)
 32722                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 32723                                  ;					  (tm15)
 32724                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 32725                                  ;
 32726                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 32727                                  ;
 32728                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 32729                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 32730                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 32731                                  ;	     affected: $P_Chk_SW_Control.
 32732                                  ;
 32733                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 32734                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 32735                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 32736                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 32737                                  ;
 32738                                  ;
 32739                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 32740                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC $P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 32741                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 32742                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 32743                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change $P_Chk_Switch to allow
 32744                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 32745                                  ;
 32746                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 32747                                  ;	     In PROC $P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 32748                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 32749                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 32750                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 32751                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 32752                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 32753                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 32754                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 32755                                  ;
 32756                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 32757                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 32758                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 32759                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 32760                                  ;	     segment.
 32761                                  ;
 32762                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 32763                                  ;	     in $p_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 32764                                  ;	     into PUSH PSDATA_SEG.  In $P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 32765                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 32766                                  ;	     Created FLag, in $P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 32767                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 32768                                  ;
 32769                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 32770                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 32771                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments

 32781                                  ;	     (apostrophe) $P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
