 32783                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 32784                                  ;
 32785                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 32786                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 32787                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 32788                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC $P_Quoted_Str.
 32789                                  ;
 32790                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 32791                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 32792                                  ;

 32794                                  ;

 32860                                  sysparse:
 32861 0000496C 2EC706[C597]0000        	mov	word [cs:$P_Flags],0	;AC034; Clear all internal flags
 32862 00004973 2E890E[4F98]            	mov	[cs:$P_ORIG_ORD],cx	;AN039; ORIGINAL ORDINAL FROM CX
 32863 00004978 2E8926[5198]            	mov	[cs:$P_ORIG_STACK],sp	;AN039; ORIGINAL VALUE OF STACK FROM SP
 32864 0000497D 2E8936[5398]            	mov	[cs:$P_ORIG_SI],si	;AN039; ORIGINAL START PARSE POINTER FROM SI
 32865                                  $P_Redo_Time:				;AN039; try to parse time again
 32866 00004982 FC                      	cld				;AN000; confirm forward direction
 32867 00004983 2E890E[B897]            	mov	[cs:$P_ORDINAL],cx      ;AC034; save operand ordinal
 32868                                  	;mov	word [cs:$P_RC],$P_No_Error
 32869 00004988 2EC706[BA97]0000        	mov	word [cs:$P_RC],0	;AC034; Assume no error
 32870 0000498F 2EC706[CD97]0000        	mov	word [cs:$P_Found_SYNONYM],0
 32871                                  					;AC034; initalize synonym pointer
 32872 00004996 2EC706[BE97]0000        	mov	word [cs:$P_DX],0	;AC034; (tm15)
 32873                                  
 32874                                  ;M029 -- Begin changes
 32875                                  ; The table of special chars $P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 32876                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 32877                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 32878                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 32879                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 32880                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
 32881                                  
 32882 0000499D 2EC706[8A98]5B5D        	mov	word [cs:$P_FileSp_Char], '[]'	 ; "[]|<>+=;\""
 32883 000049A4 2EC706[8C98]7C3C        	mov	word [cs:$P_FileSp_Char+2], '|<'
 32884 000049AB 2EC706[8E98]3E2B        	mov	word [cs:$P_FileSp_Char+4], '>+'
 32885 000049B2 2EC706[9098]3D3B        	mov 	word [cs:$P_FileSp_Char+6], '=;'
 32886                                  
 32887                                  ;M029 -- End of changes
 32888                                  
 32889 000049B9 E82809                  	call	$P_Skip_Delim		;AN000; Move si to 1st non white space
 32890 000049BC 7312                    	jnc	short $P_Start		;AN000; If EOL is not encountered, do parse
 32891

 32896                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+$P_PARMS_BLK.$P_PARMSX_Address]
 32897 000049C2 268B1D                  	mov	bx,[es:di]		;AN000; Get the PARMSX address to
 32898                                  	
 32899                                  	;cmp	cl,[es:bx+$P_PARMSX_BLK.$P_MinP]
 32900 000049C5 263A0F                  	cmp	cl,[es:bx]		;AN000; check ORDINAL to see if the minimum
 32901 000049C8 7304                    	jae	short $P_Fin		;AN000; positional found.
 32902                                  
 32903                                  	;mov	ax,2
 32904 000049CA B80200                  	mov	ax,$P_Op_Missing ; 2	;AN000; If no, set exit code to missing operand
 32905                                  	; 27/04/2023
 32906 000049CD F8                      	clc

 33279                                  ; $P_Chk_SW_Control

 33373                                  ;***********************************************************************
 33374                                  ; $P_Fill_Result
 33375                                  ;
 33376                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 33377                                  ;
 33378                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 33379                                  ;	    AL = type
 33380                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 33381                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 33382                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 33383                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 33384                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has secondsn,
 33385                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 33386                                  ;		  AL = else: psdata_seg:SI points to returned string buffer
 33387                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 33388                                  ;
 33389                                  ; Output:   None
 33390                                  ;
 33391                                  ; Use:	$P_Do_CAPS_String, $P_Remove_Colon, $P_Found_SYNONYM
 33392                                  ;
 33393                                  ; Vars: $P_DX(W)

 33395                                  
 33396                                  	; 31/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM

 35076                                  ;

 35086                                  
 35087                                  	; 05/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35088                                  	; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM

 35114 000052D0 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; set
 35115                                  	;mov	ah,$P_No_Tag ; 0FFh	;AN000;    result
 35116                                  	;mov	al,$P_Drive ; 6		;AN000; 	 buffer
 35117                                  	; 05/04/2023
 35118 000052D2 B806FF                  	mov	ax,($P_No_Tag<<8)+$P_Drive ; 06FFh
 35119 000052D5 E8D2F8                  	call	$P_Fill_Result		;AN000; 	       to drive
 35120 000052D8 EB07                    	jmp	short $P_Drv_Exit	;AN000;
 35121                                  $P_Drv_Err:				;AN000;
 35122 000052DA 2EC706[BA97]0900        	mov	word [cs:$P_RC],$P_Syntax
 35123                                  	;mov	word [cs:$P_RC],9	;AC034;
 35124                                  $P_Drv_Exit:				;AN000;
 35125 000052E1 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 35126 000052E2 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 35127 000052E3 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 35129                                  ;***********************************************************************
 35130                                  ; $P_Skip_Delim;
 35131                                  ;
 35132                                  ; Function: Skip delimiters specified in the PARMS list, white space
 35133                                  ;	    and comma.
 35134                                  ;
 35135                                  ; Input:    DS:SI -> Command String
 35136                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 35137                                  ;
 35138                                  ; Output:   CY = 1 if the end of line encounterd
 35139                                  ;	    CY = 0 then SI move to 1st non-delimiter character
 35140                                  ;	    AL = Last examineed character
 35141                                  ;
 35142                                  ; Use:	    $P_Chk_EOL, $P_Chk_Delim,
 35143                                  ;
 35144                                  ; Vars:     $P_Flags(R)
 35145                                  ;***********************************************************************
 35146                                  
 35147                                  	; 05/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35148                                  	; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 35149                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 35150                                  $P_Skip_Delim:				;AN000;
 35151                                  $P_Skip_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 35152 000052E4 AC                      	lodsb				;AN000;
 35153 000052E5 E81E00                  	call	$P_Chk_EOL		;AN000; is it EOL character ?
 35154 000052E8 7416                    	je	short $P_Skip_Delim_CY	;AN000; if yes, exit w/ CY on
 35155                                  
 35156 000052EA E84B00                  	call	$P_Chk_Delim		;AN000; is it one of delimiters ?
 35157 000052ED 7514                    	jne	short $P_Skip_Delim_NCY	;AN000; if no, exit w/ CY off
 35158                                  
 35159 000052EF 2EF606[C697]20          	test	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],$P_Extra
 35160                                  	;test	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],20h ;AC034; extra delim or comma found ?
 35161 000052F5 74ED                    	jz	short $P_Skip_Delim_Loop
 35162                                  					;AN000; if no, loop
 35163 000052F7 2EF606[C697]41          	test	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],$P_SW+$P_equ
 35164                                  	;;test	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],41h	;AC034; /x , or xxx=zzz , (tm08)
 35165                                  	;jz	short $P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; no switch, no keyword (tm08)
 35166                                  	;dec	si ; *			;AN000; backup si for next call (tm08)
 35167                                  	;;jmp	short $P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; else exit w/ CY off
 35168                                  	; 05/04/2023
 35169 000052FD 7505                    	jnz	short $P_Skip_Delim_Exit ; cf = 0
 35170                                  $P_Exit_At_Extra:			;AN000;
 35171                                  	; cf = 0
 35172                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate extra delim
 35173 000052FF C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 35174                                  
 35175                                  $P_Skip_Delim_CY:			;AN000;
 35176 00005300 F9                      	stc				;AN000; indicate EOL
 35177 00005301 EB01                    	jmp	short $P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 35178                                  					;AN000;
 35179                                  $P_Skip_Delim_NCY:			;AN000;
 35180 00005303 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate non delim
 35181                                  $P_Skip_Delim_Exit:			;AN000; in this case, need
 35182 00005304 4E                      	dec	si ; *			;AN000;  backup index pointer
 35183 00005305 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 35184                                  	; 05/04/2023
 35185                                  ;$P_Exit_At_Extra:			;AN000;
 35186                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate extra delim
 35187                                  	;retn				;AN000;
 35188                                  
 35189                                  ;***********************************************************************
 35190                                  ; $P_Chk_EOL;
 35191                                  ;
 35192                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 35193                                  ;
 35194                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 35195                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 35196                                  ;
 35197                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 35198                                  ;***********************************************************************
 35199                                  
 35200                                  	; 05/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35201                                  	; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 35202                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 35203                                  $P_Chk_EOL:
 35204 00005306 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 35205 00005307 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 35206 00005308 3C0D                    	cmp	al,$P_CR ; 0Dh		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 35207 0000530A 7429                    	je	short $P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 35208 0000530C 3C00                    	cmp	al,$P_NULL ; 0		;AN000; zero ?
 35209 0000530E 7425                    	je	short $P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 35210 00005310 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+$P_PARMS_BLK.$P_Num_Extra],$P_I_Have_EOL
 35211                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di+2],2	;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 35212 00005315 721E                    	jb	short $P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 35213 00005317 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 35214 00005319 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+$P_PARMS_BLK.$P_Len_Extra_Delim]
 35215                                  	;mov	bl,[es:di+3]		;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 35216 0000531D 83C304                  	add	bx,$P_Len_PARMS; 4 	;AN000; skip it
 35217 00005320 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],$P_I_Use_Default
 35218                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bx+di],0	;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 35219 00005324 740D                    	je	short $P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 35220 00005326 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra chcracter
 35221 00005328 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000;
 35222                                  $P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 35223 0000532B 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 35224 0000532C 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 35225 0000532F 7404                    	je	short $P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 35226 00005331 E2F8                    	loop	$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 35227                                  $P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 35228 00005333 3C0D                    	cmp	al,$P_CR ; 0Dh		;AN000; reset ZF
 35229                                  $P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 35230 00005335 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 35231 00005336 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 35232 00005337 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 35233                                  
 35234                                  ;***********************************************************************
 35235                                  ; $P_Chk_Delim;
 35236                                  ;
 35237                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 35238                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 35239                                  ;	    blanks.
 35240                                  ;
 35241                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 35242                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 35243                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 35244                                  ;
 35245                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 35246                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 35247                                  ; Vars:  $P_Terminator(W), $P_Flags(W)
 35248                                  ;***********************************************************************
 35249                                  
 35250                                  	; 06/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35251                                  	; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 35252                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 35253                                  $P_Chk_Delim:
 35254 00005338 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 35255 00005339 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 35256 0000533A 2EC606[C097]20          	mov	byte [cs:$P_Terminator],$P_Space ; 20h
 35257                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 35258 00005340 2E8026[C697]DF          	and	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],0FFh-$P_Extra ; 0DFh
 35259                                  					;AC034;
 35260 00005346 3C20                    	cmp	al,$P_Space ; 20h ; ' '	;AN000; Space ?
 35261 00005348 7434                    	je	short $P_Chk_Delim_Exit	;AN000;
 35262                                  
 35263 0000534A 3C09                    	cmp	al,$P_TAB ; 09h		;AN000; TAB ?
 35264 0000534C 7430                    	je	short $P_Chk_Delim_Exit	;AN000;
 35265                                  
 35266 0000534E 3C2C                    	cmp	al,$P_Comma  ; ',' 	;AN000; Comma ?
 35267 00005350 742F                    	je	short $P_Chk_Delim_Exit0
 35268                                  					;AN000;
 35269                                  $P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 35270 00005352 3C20                    	cmp	al,20h ; $P_DBSP1	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 35271 00005354 750C                    	jne	short $P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 35272 00005356 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],20h ; $P_DBSP2
 35273                                  					;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 35274 00005359 7507                    	jne	short $P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 35275 0000535B B020                    	mov	al,$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000;
 35276 0000535D 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 35277 0000535E 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 35278 00005360 EB1C                    	jmp	short $P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 35279                                  
 35280                                  $P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 35281                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di+$P_PARMS_BLK.$P_Num_Extra],$P_I_Have_Delim
 35282 00005362 26807D0201              	cmp	byte [es:di+$P_PARMS_BLK.$P_Num_Extra],1
 35283                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di+2],1	;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 35284 00005367 7215                    	jb	short $P_Chk_Delim_Exit	;AN000;
 35285                                  
 35286 00005369 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 35287 0000536B 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+$P_PARMS_BLK.$P_Len_Extra_Delim]
 35288                                  	;mov	cl,[esi:di+3]		;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 35289                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 35290                                  	;jz	short $P_Chk_Delim_NZ	;AN000;
 35291                                  	; 12/08/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM
 35292 0000536F E30B                    	jcxz	$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 35293                                  
 35294 00005371 BB0300                  	mov	bx,$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 35295                                  $P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 35296 00005374 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 35297 00005375 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 35298 00005378 7407                    	je	short $P_Chk_Delim_Exit0
 35299                                  					;AN000;
 35300 0000537A E2F8                    	loop	$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 35301                                  
 35302                                  $P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 35303 0000537C 3C20                    	cmp	al,$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; reset ZF
 35304                                  $P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 35305 0000537E 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 35306 0000537F 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 35307 00005380 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 35308                                  
 35309                                  $P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 35310 00005381 2EA2[C097]              	mov	[cs:$P_Terminator],al	;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 35311 00005385 2EF606[C697]01          	test	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],$P_equ
 35312                                  	;test	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],1	;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 35313 0000538B 7506                    	jnz	short $P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 35314                                  
 35315 0000538D 2E800E[C697]20          	or	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],$P_Extra ; 20h
 35316                                  	;or	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],20h	;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 35317                                  $P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 35318 00005393 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 35319 00005395 EBE7                    	jmp	short $P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 35321                                  ;***********************************************************************
 35322                                  ; $P_Chk_Switch;
 35323                                  ;
 35324                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 35325                                  ;	    $P_STRING_BUF
 35326                                  ;
 35327                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 35328                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within $P_String_Buf
 35329                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 35330                                  ;
 35331                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 35332                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 35333                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 35334                                  ;
 35335                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 35336                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 35337                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 35338                                  ;
 35339                                  ; Vars:  $P_Terminator(W)
 35340                                  ;
 35341                                  ; Use:	 $P_0099
 35342                                  ;***********************************************************************
 35343                                  
 35344                                  	; 06/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35345                                  	; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 35346                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 35347                                  $P_Chk_Switch:
 35348                                  	; 18/04/2023
 35349 00005397 8D2E[CF97]              	lea	bp,$P_STRING_BUF	;AN020;AC034; BP=OFFSET of $P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 35350                                  
 35351 0000539B 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 35352 0000539D 7418                    	je	short $P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 35353                                  
 35354 0000539F 3C2F                    	cmp     al,$P_Switch ; '/'	;AN000;
 35355 000053A1 7512                    	jne	short $P_STRUC_L5	;AN000;
 35356                                  
 35357 000053A3 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash, now see if might be in date string
 35358 000053A4 50                      	push	ax			;AN020;save input char
 35359 000053A5 2E8A47FF                	mov	al,[cs:bx-1]		;AN026;AL=char before the current char
 35360 000053A9 E8FBFA                  	call	$P_0099 		;AN020;return carry set if not numeric
 35361 000053AC 7205                    	jc	short $P_STRUC_L7	;AN000;
 35362                                  
 35363 000053AE 8A04                    	mov	al,[si]			;AN020;AL=char after the current char
 35364 000053B0 E8F4FA                  	call	$P_0099			;AN020;return carry set if not numeric
 35365                                  $P_STRUC_L7:				;AN000;
 35366 000053B3 58                      	pop	ax			;AN020;restore AL to input char
 35367                                  	;jmp	short $P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 35368                                  	; 18/04/2023
 35369 000053B4 C3                      	retn
 35370                                  
 35371                                  $P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 35372 000053B5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;not a slash
 35373                                  	;jmp	short $P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 35374                                  	 ;18/04/2023
 35375 000053B6 C3                      	retn
 35376                                  
 35377                                  $P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 35378 000053B7 3C2F                    	cmp     al,$P_Switch ; '/'	;AN000;
 35379                                  	;jne	short $P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 35380                                  	; 18/04/2023
 35381 000053B9 75FA                    	jne	short $P_STRUC_L5
 35382                                  
 35383 000053BB 2E800E[C697]40          	or	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],$P_SW
 35384                                  	;or	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],40h	;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 35385                                  	; 18/04/2023
 35386                                  ;$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 35387                                  	;clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 35388                                  $P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 35389 000053C1 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 35391                                  ;**************************************************************************
 35392                                  ; $P_Chk_DBCS:
 35393                                  ;
 35394                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 35395                                  ;
 35396                                  ;  Input:
 35397                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 35398                                  ;
 35399                                  ;  Output:
 35400                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 35401                                  ;
 35402                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 35403                                  ;
 35404                                  ; Vars:  $P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), $P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 35405                                  ;***************************************************************************
 35406                                  
 35407                                  	; 06/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35408                                  	; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 35409                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 35410                                  $P_Chk_DBCS:
 35411 000053C2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 35412 000053C3 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 35413 000053C4 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 35414 000053C5 2E833E[C397]00          	cmp	word [cs:$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0
 35415                                  					;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 35416 000053CB 7527                    	jne	short $P_DBCS00		;AN000;
 35417 000053CD 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 35418 000053CE 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 35419 000053CF 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 35420 000053D0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 35421 000053D1 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 35422 000053D2 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 35423 000053D3 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 35424 000053D4 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 35425 000053D6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 35426                                  	;mov	ax,$P_DOS_GetEV 	;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 35427 000053D8 B80063                  	mov	ax,6300h
 35428 000053DB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 35429 000053DD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 35430 000053DF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 35431 000053E1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 35432 000053E2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 35433 000053E3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 35434 000053E4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 35435 000053E5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 35436 000053E6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 35437 000053E7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 35438 000053E8 7424                    	jz	short $P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 35439                                  $P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 35440 000053EA 2E8936[C197]            	mov	[cs:$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 35441 000053EF 2E891E[C397]            	mov	[cs:$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 35442                                  $P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 35443                                  	;mov	si,[cs:$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 35444                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 35445                                  	; 12/08/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM
 35446 000053F4 2EC536[C197]            	lds	si,[cs:$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 35447                                  $P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 35448 000053F9 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0 		;AN000; zero vector ?
 35449 000053FC 7410                    	je	short $P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 35450 000053FE 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 35451 00005400 7208                    	jb	short $P_DBCS01		;AN000; Check if AL is in
 35452 00005402 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 35453 00005405 7703                    	ja	short $P_DBCS01		;AN000;      the vector
 35454 00005407 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 35455 00005408 EB04                    	jmp	short $P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 35456                                  $P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 35457 0000540A 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 35458 0000540B 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 35459                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 35460 0000540C EBEB                    	jmp	short $P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 35461                                  
 35462                                  $P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 35463                                  	; 18/04/2023
 35464                                  	; cf=0
 35465                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 35466                                  $P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 35467 0000540E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 35468 0000540F 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 35469 00005410 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 35470 00005411 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 35554                                  ;****************************************************************
 35555                                  ;*
 35556                                  ;* ROUTINE:	STD_PRINTF/STD_EPRINTF
 35557                                  ;*
 35558                                  ;* FUNCTION:	Set up to print out a message using SYSDISPMSG.
 35559                                  ;*		Set up substitutions if utility message.  Make
 35560                                  ;*		sure any changes to message variables in TDATA
 35561                                  ;*		are reset to avoid reloading the transient.
 35562                                  ;*
 35563                                  ;* INPUT:	Msg_Disp_Class	-  set to message class
 35564                                  ;*		Msg_Cont_Flag	-  set to control flags
 35565                                  ;*		DS	points to transient segment
 35566                                  ;*
 35567                                  ;*		if utility message:
 35568                                  ;*		DX	points to a block with message number
 35569                                  ;*			(word), number of substitutions (byte),
 35570                                  ;*			followed by substitution list if there
 35571                                  ;*			are substitutions.  If substitutions
 35572                                  ;*			are not in transient segment they must
 35573                                  ;*			be set.
 35574                                  ;*		else
 35575                                  ;*		AX	set to message number
 35576                                  ;*
 35577                                  ;* OUTPUT:	none
 35578                                  ;*
 35579                                  ;****************************************************************
 35580

 35816                                  
 35817                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35818                                  ; MODULE NAME: MSGSERV.SAL
 35819                                  ;
 35820                                  ; DESCRIPTIVE NAME: Message Services SALUT file
 35821                                  ;
 35822                                  ; FUNCTION: This module incorporates all the messages services and
 35823                                  ;	    is called upon at build time to INCLUDE the code requested
 35824                                  ;	    by a utility. Code is requested using the macro MSG_SERVICES.
 35825                                  ;
 35826                                  ; ENTRY POINT: Since this a collection of subroutines, entry point is at
 35827                                  ;	    requested procedure.
 35828                                  ;
 35829                                  ; INPUT: Since this a collection of subroutines, input is dependent on
 35830                                  ;	    function requested.
 35831                                  ;
 35832                                  ; EXIT-NORMAL: In all cases, CARRY FLAG = 0
 35833                                  ;
 35834                                  ; EXIT-ERROR: In all cases, CARRY FLAG = 1
 35835                                  ;
 35836                                  ; INTERNAL REFERENCES: (list of included subroutines)
 35837                                  ;
 35838                                  ;	- SYSLOADMSG
 35839                                  ;	- SYSDISPMSG
 35840                                  ;	- SYSGETMSG
 35841                                  ;
 35842                                  ; EXTERNAL REFERENCES: None
 35843                                  ;
 35844                                  ; NOTES: At build time, some modules must be included. These are only included
 35845                                  ;	 once using assembler switches. Other logic is included at the request
 35846                                  ;	 of the utility.
 35847                                  ;
 35848                                  ;	 COMR and COMT are assembler switches to conditionally assemble code
 35849                                  ;	 for RESIDENT COMMAND.COM and TRANSIENT COMMAND.COM to reduce resident
 35850                                  ;	 storage and multiple EQUates.
 35851                                  ;
 35852                                  ; REVISION HISTORY: Created MAY 1987
 35853                                  ;
 35854                                  ;     Label: DOS - - Message Retriever
 35855                                  ;	     (c) Copyright 1988 Microsoft
 35856                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35857                                  
 35858                                  ;	Revision History
 35859                                  ;	================
 35860                                  ;
 35861                                  ;	M007	SR	08/24/90	Fixed bug #1818 -- changed
 35862                                  ;				$M_DISPLAY_H_STRING to properly
 35863                                  ;				handle Ctrl-Z being passed
 35864                                  ;
 35865                                  ;	M013	SR	9/12/90	Make SETSTDIO flag false so that all
 35866                                  ;				these routines are no longer assembled.
 35867                                  ;
 35868                                  ;	M016	SR	10/14/90	Bug #3380. Changed SYSLOADMSG so that
 35869                                  ;				CR-LF string also gets reinitialized
 35870                                  ;				on every cycle.
 35871                                  ;
 35872                                  ;	M020	SR	10/26/90	Bug #3380 again. Initialize $M_DIVISOR
 35873                                  ;				& $_MSG_NUM also in SYSLOADMSG.
 35874                                  
 35875                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35876

 35883                                  ; .$M_S_RESV:	resb 1		;;AN000;; RESERVED
 35884                                  ; .$M_S_VALUE:	resd 1 		;;AN000;; Time, Date or PTR to data item
 35885                                  ; .$M_S_ID:	resb 1		;;AN000;; n of %n

 35887                                  ; .$M_S_MAXW:	resb 1		;;AN000;; Maximum field width

 36163                                  ;;  Proc Name:	SYSGETMSG

 36165                                  ;;  Function:	The GET service returns the segment, offset and size of the
 36166                                  ;;		message text to the caller based on a message number.
 36167                                  ;;		The GET function will not display the message thus assumes
 36168                                  ;;		caller will handle replaceable parameters.
 36169                                  ;;
 36170                                  ;;  Inputs:
 36171                                  ;;
 36172                                  ;;  Outputs:
 36173                                  ;;
 36174                                  ;;  Psuedocode:
 36175                                  ;;		Call $M_GET_MSG_ADDRESS
 36176                                  ;;		IF MSG_NUM exists THEN
 36177                                  ;;		   Set DS:SI = MSG_TXT_PTR + 1
 36178                                  ;;		   CARRY_FLAG = 0
 36179                                  ;;		ELSE
 36180                                  ;;		   CARRY_FLAG = 1
 36181                                  ;;		ENDIF
 36182                                  ;;

 36562                                  ;;
 36563                                  ;;  Proc Name:	SYSDISPMSG
 36564                                  ;;
 36565                                  ;;  Function:	The DISPLAY service will output a defined message to a handle
 36566                                  ;;		requested by the caller. It also provides function to display
 36567                                  ;;		messages when handles are not applicable (ie. DOS function calls
 36568                                  ;;		00h to 0Ah) Replaceable parameters are allowed and are
 36569                                  ;;		defined previous to entry.
 36570                                  ;;
 36571                                  ;;		It is assumes that a PRELOAD function has already determined
 36572                                  ;;		the addressibilty internally to the message retriever services.
 36573                                  ;;  Inputs:
 36574                                  ;;
 36575                                  ;;  Outputs:
 36576                                  ;;
 36577                                  ;;  Psuedocode:
 36578                                  ;;		Save registers needed later
 36579                                  ;;		Get address of the message requested
 36580                                  ;;		IF Message number exists THEN
 36581                                  ;;		  IF replacable parameters were specified THEN
 36582                                  ;;		     Display message with replacable parms
 36583                                  ;;		  ELSE
 36584                                  ;;		     Display string without replacable parms
 36585                                  ;;		  ENDIF
 36586                                  ;;		  IF character input was requested THEN
 36587                                  ;;		     Wait for character input
 36588                                  ;;		  ENDIF
 36589                                  ;;		  Clear CARRY FLAG
 36590                                  ;;		ELSE
 36591                                  ;;		   Set CARRY FLAG
 36592                                  ;;		ENDIF
 36593                                  ;;		Return
 36594                                  ;;
 36595                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36596                                  
 36597                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM

 36858                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36859                                  ;;
 36860                                  ;; Scan_ctrlZ: This routine looks through the string to be printed and 
 36861                                  ;; truncates it at the Ctrl-Z if any present.
 36862                                  ;;
 36863                                  ;;	ENTRY:	ds:dx = String to be displayed
 36864                                  ;;		cx = number of chars to be displayed
 36865                                  ;;
 36866                                  ;;	EXIT:	cx = number of chars to be displayed
 36867                                  ;;
 36868                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36869                                  
 36870                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 36871                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 36872                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 36873                                  scan_ctrlz:
 36874 000057A1 57                      	push	di
 36875 000057A2 50                      	push	ax
 36876 000057A3 06                      	push	es
 36877 000057A4 53                      	push	bx
 36878                                  
 36879 000057A5 89D7                    	mov	di,dx
 36880 000057A7 1E                      	push	ds
 36881 000057A8 07                      	pop	es   			;es:di points at string
 36882                                  
 36883 000057A9 89CB                    	mov	bx,cx			;save current count
 36884                                  
 36885 000057AB B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah	; Ctrl-Z
 36886 000057AD FC                      	cld
 36887 000057AE F2AE                    	repne	scasb			;find first Ctrl-Z
 36888 000057B0 7503                    	jnz	short noCtrlZ		;no CtrlZ found in string
 36889                                  
 36890 000057B2 29CB                    	sub	bx,cx
 36891 000057B4 4B                      	dec	bx			;bx = new count to display
 36892                                  noCtrlZ:
 36893 000057B5 89D9                    	mov	cx,bx			;cx = actual display count
 36894                                  
 36895 000057B7 5B                      	pop	bx
 36896 000057B8 07                      	pop	es
 36897 000057B9 58                      	pop	ax
 36898 000057BA 5F                      	pop	di
 36899                                  $MIF127:	; 08/04/2023
 36900 000057BB C3                      	retn
 36901                                  
 36902                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36903                                  ;;
 36904                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_DISPLAY_H_STRING
 36905                                  ;;
 36906                                  ;;	FUNCTION:  Will display a string to a specified handle
 36907                                  ;;	INPUTS:    ES:DI points to beginning of message
 36908                                  ;;		   CX contains the number of bytes to write
 36909                                  ;;		   BX contains the handle to write to
 36910                                  ;;	OUPUTS:    None
 36911                                  ;;	REGS USED: AX,DX
 36912                                  ;;
 36913                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36914                                  
 36915                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 36916                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 36917                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 36918                                  $M_DISPLAY_H_STRING:
 36919 000057BC 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;;AN002;; Set number of bytes written to 0
 36920 000057BE 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;;AN002;; For performance, don't write if not necessary
 36921 000057C0 74F9                    	jz	short $MIF127
 36922                                  	
 36923 000057C2 1E                      	push	ds			;;AN000;;
 36924 000057C3 06                      	push	es			;;AN000;;
 36925 000057C4 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 36926                                  	
 36927 000057C5 B440                    	mov	ah,40h ; DOS_WRITE_HANDLE ;;AN000;; DOS function to write to a handle
 36928 000057C7 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			;;AN000;; Pointer to data to write
 36929                                  
 36930 000057C9 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1 ; $M_SINGLE_CHAR	;;AN000;; Is this a single character?
 36931 000057CC 7528                    	jne	short $MIF128		;;AN000;; No
 36932                                  
 36933 000057CE CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write character
 36934                                  		; DOS - 2+ - WRITE TO FILE WITH HANDLE
 36935                                  		; BX = file handle, CX = number of bytes to writ
 36936                                  
 36937 000057D0 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 36938 000057D1 50                      	push	ax			;;AN000;;
 36939 000057D2 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di] 		;;AN000;; Get the character
 36940 000057D5 E85800                  	CALL    $M_IS_IT_DBCS		;;AN000;; Is this the first byte of a DB character
 36941 000057D8 58                      	pop	ax			;;AN000;;
 36942 000057D9 1E                      	push	ds			;;AN000;;
 36943 000057DA 06                      	push	es			;;AN000;;
 36944 000057DB 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 36945 000057DC 7306                    	jnc	short $MIF129
 36946                                  	
 36947 000057DE F8                      	clc				;;AN000;; Clear the DBCS indicator
 36948 000057DF B440                    	mov	ah,40h ; DOS_WRITE_HANDLE ;;AN000;; DOS function to write to a handle
 36949 000057E1 42                      	inc	dx			;;AN000;; Point to next character
 36950 000057E2 CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write character
 36951                                  		; DOS - 2+ - WRITE TO FILE WITH HANDLE
 36952                                  		; BX = file handle, CX = number of bytes to write, 
 36953                                  $MIF129:
 36954                                  ;SR;
 36955                                  ; If the single char happened to be a Ctrl-Z, the dos write would return
 36956                                  ;0 chars written making the caller think there was an error writing. To 
 36957                                  ;avoid this, we check if the single char was a Ctrl-Z and if so, return that
 36958                                  ;the char was written, thus fooling the caller.
 36959                                  
 36960 000057E4 9C                      	pushf				;save flags
 36961 000057E5 26803D1A                	cmp	byte [es:di],1Ah	;is char a Ctrl-Z?
 36962 000057E9 7502                    	jne	short m_popf_j		;no, continue
 36963                                  
 36964 000057EB 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;yes, fake as if it was written
 36965                                  m_popf_j:
 36966                                  	; 08/04/2023
 36967                                  	;$M_POPF  ; macro in 'sysmsg.inc' (MSDOS 6.0)
 36968 000057ED EB01                    	jmp	short m_popf		;restore flags
 36969                                  
 36970                                  ; 07/04/2023
 36971                                  ; ---------------------------
 36972                                  ; MSDOS 6.0, SYSMSG.INC, 1991
 36973                                  ; ---------------------------
 36974                                  	; $M_POPF macro
 36975                                  	;jmp	short $+3
 36976                                  intret:
 36977 000057EF CF                      	iret
 36978                                  m_popf:
 36979 000057F0 0E                      	push	cs
 36980 000057F1 E8FBFF                  	call	intret
 36981                                  	;;; end macro	
 36982                                  ; ---------------------------
 36983                                  
 36984 000057F4 EB18                    	jmp	short $MEN128
 36985                                  
 36986                                  $MIF128:
 36987                                  ;SR;
 36988                                  ; Prescan the string looking for Ctrl-Z. We terminate the message the moment 
 36989                                  ;we hit a Ctrl-Z. cx will contain the number of characters to be printed.
 36990                                  
 36991 000057F6 55                      	push	bp			; M007
 36992 000057F7 51                      	push	cx
 36993 000057F8 E8A6FF                  	call	scan_ctrlz		;cx = count without Ctrl-Z
 36994 000057FB 89CD                    	mov	bp,cx			;store no ^Z count in bp ;M007
 36995 000057FD 59                      	pop	cx			;get old count back ;M007
 36996                                  	
 36997 000057FE CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write String at DS:SI to handle
 36998                                  	;jnc	short chk_count		;no error, adjust return count
 36999                                  	;jmp	short m_cnt_ok		;error, return with carry set;M007
 37000                                  	; 08/04/2023
 37001 00005800 720B                    	jc	short m_cnt_ok
 37002                                  ;M007
 37003                                  ; If we are writing to con and there is a Ctrl-Z in the string, the
 37004                                  ;return count will be much less and if this returns to the caller we can get
 37005                                  ;spurious error messages. We check here if the count returned is same as
 37006                                  ;original count or same as the count if we stop at Ctrl-Z. In the second
 37007                                  ;case, we fake it as if all bytes have been written. If the return count
 37008                                  ;does not match either count, then we had some other disk error (such as
 37009                                  ;insufficient disk space) and we pass it through
 37010                                  
 37011                                  chk_count:
 37012 00005802 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax			;have all bytes been written?;M007
 37013 00005804 7407                    	je	short m_cnt_ok		;there was an error writing ;M007
 37014 00005806 39C5                    	cmp	bp,ax			;count = Ctrl-Z count? ;M007
 37015 00005808 F8                      	clc				;no error either way ;M007
 37016 00005809 7502                    	jne	short m_cnt_ok		;no, pass it through ;M007
 37017 0000580B 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;return old count ;M007
 37018                                  m_cnt_ok:				; M007
 37019 0000580D 5D                      	pop	bp			; M007
 37020                                  $MEN128:
 37021 0000580E 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;;
 37022                                  ;$MIF127: ; 08/04/2023
 37023 0000580F C3                      	retn
 37024

 37084                                  ;;
 37085                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_IS_IT_DBCS
 37086                                  ;;
 37087                                  ;;	FUNCTION:  Will decide whether character is Single or Double Byte
 37088                                  ;;	INPUTS:    AL contains the byte to be checked
 37089                                  ;;	OUTPUTS:   Carry flag = 0 if byte is NOT in DBCS range
 37090                                  ;;		   Carry flag = 1 if byte IS in DBCS range
 37091                                  ;;	REGS USED: All restored
 37092                                  ;;
 37093                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 37094                                  
 37095                                  	; 09/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 37096                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 37097                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 37098                                  $M_IS_IT_DBCS:
 37099 00005830 06                      	push	es			;;AN000;; Save Extra Segment register
 37100 00005831 57                      	push	di			;;AN000;; Save DI register
 37101                                  
 37102 00005832 C43E[D098]              	les	di,[$M_RT+$M_RES_ADDRS.$M_DBCS_VEC]
 37103                                  	;les	di,[$M_RT+60]		;;AN000;;
 37104 00005836 09FF                    	or	di,di			;;AN000;; Was the DBCS vector set?
 37105 00005838 7417                    	jz	short $MIF138		;;AN000;; No
 37106                                  $MDO139:
 37107 0000583A 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0 ; $M_DBCS_TERM
 37108                                  					;;AN000;; Is this the terminating flag?
 37109 0000583E F8                      	clc				;;AN000;;
 37110 0000583F 7410                    	jz	short $MEN139
 37111                                  					;;AN000;; No
 37112 00005841 263A05                  	cmp	al,[es:di]		;;AN000;; Does the character fall in the DBCS range?
 37113 00005844 7207                    	jnae	short $MIF141 ; jb	;;AN000;; No		
 37114 00005846 263A4501                	cmp	al,[es:di+1]		;;AN000;; Does the character fall in the DBCS range?
 37115 0000584A 7701                    	jnbe	short $MIF141 ; ja	;;AN000;; No
 37116                                  					;;AN000;; Yes
 37117 0000584C F9                      	stc				;;AN000;; Set carry flag
 37118                                  $MIF141:
 37119 0000584D 47                      	inc	di			;;AN000;;
 37120 0000584E 47                      	inc	di			;;AN000;;
 37121 0000584F EBE9                    	jmp	short $MDO139		;;AN000;; Go to next vector
 37122                                  $MEN139:
 37123                                  $MIF138:
 37124 00005851 5F                      	pop	di			;;AN000;; Restore DI register
 37125 00005852 07                      	pop	es			;;AN000;; Restore Extra Segment register
 37126 00005853 C3                      	retn				;;AN000;; Return

 37128                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 37129                                  ;;
 37130                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_CONVERT2ASC
 37131                                  ;;
 37132                                  ;;	FUNCTION: Convert a binary number to a ASCII string
 37133                                  ;;	INPUTS: DX:AX contains the number to be converted
 37134                                  ;;		$M_RT_DIVISOR contains the divisor
 37135                                  ;;	OUTPUTS: CX contains the number of characters
 37136                                  ;;		Top of stack  --> Last character
 37137                                  ;;				     . . .
 37138                                  ;;		Bot of stack  --> First character
 37139                                  ;;	REGS USED:
 37140                                  ;;
 37141                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 37142                                  
 37143                                  	; 09/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 37144                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 37145                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 37146                                  $M_CONVERT2ASC:
 37147 00005854 8F06[DA98]              	pop	word [$M_RT+$M_RES_ADDRS.$M_RETURN_ADDR]
 37148                                  	;pop	word [$M_RT+70]			;;AN000;; Save Return Address
 37149                                  	
 37150 00005858 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx				;;AN000;; Use BX as a swapping register
 37151 0000585A 93                      	xchg	bx,ax				;;AN000;; Initialize - Low Word in BX
 37152 0000585B 92                      	xchg	ax,dx				;;AN000;;	  - High Word in AX
 37153                                  $MDO145:					;;AN000;; DO UNTIL Low Word becomes zero
 37154 0000585C F736[DE98]              	div	word [$M_RT+$M_RES_ADDRS.$M_DIVISOR]
 37155                                  	;div	word [$M_RT+74]			;;AN000;; Divide High Word by divisor
 37156 00005860 93                      	xchg	bx,ax				;;AN000;; Setup to divide Low Word using remainder
 37157                                  						;;AN000;;  and save reduced High Word in BX
 37158 00005861 F736[DE98]              	div	word [$M_RT+$M_RES_ADDRS.$M_DIVISOR]
 37159                                  	;div	word [$M_RT+74]			;;AN000;; Divide Low Word by divisor
 37160

 37257                                  ;;
 37258                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_DISPLAY_MESSAGE
 37259                                  ;;
 37260                                  ;;	FUNCTION:  Will display or write entire message (with replacable parameters)
 37261                                  ;;	INPUTS:    ES:DI points to beginning of message
 37262                                  ;;		   DS:SI points to first sublist structure in chain
 37263                                  ;;		   BX contains the handle to write to (if applicable)
 37264                                  ;;		   CX contains the length of string to write (before substitutions)
 37265                                  ;;		   BP contains the count of replacables
 37266                                  ;;
 37267                                  ;;	OUTPUTS:
 37268                                  ;;	REGS USED: All
 37269                                  ;;
 37270                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 37271                                  
 37272                                  	; 10/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 37273                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:54DBh
 37274                                  
 37275                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 37276                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:54DBh
 37277                                  
 37278                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 37279                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5B2Eh
 37280                                  
 37281                                  $M_DISPLAY_MESSAGE:
 37282                                  ; $DO						;;AN000;; Note: DS:SI -> message
 37283                                  $MDO165:

 37285 000058A4 09C9                    	or	cx,cx				;;AN000;; Are we finished the message yet?
 37286                                  ;; $IF NZ					;;AN000;; No
 37287 000058A6 741F                    	jz	short $MIF166			;;AN000;; Yes
 37288                                  	;mov	ah,"%"				;;AN000;; Prepare to scan for %
 37289                                  	;mov	al,0				;;AN004;;

 37292                                  ;; $DO						;;AN000;; Scan through string until %
 37293                                  $MDO167:

 37295                                  ;; $LEAVE E,AND					;;AN000;; No

 37297 000058B0 26386501                	cmp	byte [es:di+1],ah		;;AN000;; Is the next character also a %

 37310                                  ;;; $ENDIF					;;AN004;;
 37311                                  $MIF169:

 37313 000058C4 42                      	inc	dx				;;AN000;; Size = Size + 1
 37314                                  	;dec	cx				;;AN000;; Decrement total size

 37855                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_CHAR_REPLACE
 37856                                  ;;
 37857                                  ;;	FUNCTION: Will prepare a single char or ASCIIZ string for replace

 37904                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_BIN2ASC_REPLACE
 37905                                  ;;
 37906                                  ;;	FUNCTION: Convert a signed or unsigned binary number to an ASCII string
 37907                                  ;;		  and prepare to display
 37908                                  ;;	INPUTS: DS:SI points at corresponding SUBLIST
 37909                                  ;;		ES:DI contains the VALUE from SUBLIST
 37910                                  ;;	OUTPUTS: CX contains number of characters on stack
 37911                                  ;;		 Top of stack  --> Last character
 37912                                  ;;					. . .
 37913                                  ;;		 Bot of stack  --> First character
 37914                                  ;;	OTHER REGS Revised: BX,DX,AX
 37915                                  ;;
 37916                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 37917                                  
 37918                                  	; 12/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 37919                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 37920                                  	; 12/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 37921                                  $M_BIN2ASC_REPLACE:
 37922 00005ABC 5D                      	pop	bp				;;AN000;; Save return address
 37923 00005ABD 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx				;;AN000;; Prepare for get binary value (HIGH)
 37924 00005ABF 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax				;;AN000;; Prepare for get binary value (LOW)
 37925 00005AC1 C706[DE98]1000          	mov	word [$M_RT+$M_RES_ADDRS.$M_DIVISOR],16 ; $M_BASE16
 37926                                  	;mov	word [$M_RT+74],16  ; $M_BASE16	;;AN000;; Set default divisor
 37927                                  
 37928 00005AC7 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx				;;AN000;; Use BX as the NEG flag (if applicable)
 37929                                  
 37930                                  	;test	$M_SL.$M_S_FLAG,not $M_BYTE and $M_SIZE_MASK
 37931 00005AC9 F6440720                	test	byte [si+$M_SUBLIST_STRUC.$M_S_FLAG],20h

 37933 00005ACD 7511                    	jnz	short $MIF325			;;AN000;; No
 37934                                  	
 37935 00005ACF 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di]			;;AN000;; Setup byte in AL

 38497                                  ;;
 38498                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_WAIT_FOR_INPUT
 38499                                  ;;
 38500                                  ;;	FUNCTION:  To accept keyed input and return extended key value
 38501                                  ;;		   in AX register
 38502                                  ;;	INPUTS:    DL contains the DOS function requested for input
 38503                                  ;;	OUTPUTS:   AX contains the extended key value that was read
 38504                                  ;;	REGS USED:
 38505                                  ;;
 38506                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 38507                                  
 38508                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38509                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6123h
 38510                                  
 38511                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 38512                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5FA1h
 38513                                  $M_WAIT_FOR_INPUT:
 38514 00005CB1 51                      	push	cx				;;AN000;; Save CX
 38515 00005CB2 52                      	push	dx				;;AN000;; Save DX
 38516 00005CB3 1E                      	push	ds				;;AN000;; Save Data segment
 38517                                  
 38518 00005CB4 80FAC0                  	cmp	dl,0C0h ; DOS_CLR_KEYB_BUF_MASK	;;AN001;; Are we to clear the keyboard buffer?
 38519 00005CB7 7608                    	jna	short $MIF388	; jbe		;;AN001;; No,
 38520                                  						;;AN001;; Yes,
 38521 00005CB9 88D0                    	mov	al,dl				;;AN001;; Mov function into AL
 38522 00005CBB 240F                    	and	al,0Fh	; LOW_NIB_MASK		;;AN001;; Mask out the C in high nibble
 38523 00005CBD B40C                    	mov	ah,0Ch	; DOS_CLR_KEYB_BUF 	;;AN001;; Set input function
 38524 00005CBF EB02                    	jmp	short $MEN388
 38525                                  $MIF388:
 38526 00005CC1 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl				;;AN000;; Put DOS function in AH
 38527                                  $MEN388:
 38528 00005CC3 06                      	push	es				;;AN000;; Get output buffer segment
 38529 00005CC4 1F                      	pop	ds				;;AN000;;
 38530 00005CC5 89FA                    	mov	dx,di				;;AN000;; Get output buffer offset in case needed
 38531 00005CC7 CD21                    	int	21h				;;AN000;; Get keyboard input
 38532 00005CC9 1F                      	pop	ds				;;AN000;;
 38533 00005CCA 80FA0A                  	cmp	dl,0Ah	; DOS_BUF_KEYB_INP	;;AN000;;
 38534                                  	;clc					;;AN000;;
 38535 00005CCD 7412                    	je	short $MIF391
 38536 00005CCF E85EFB                  	call	$M_IS_IT_DBCS			;;AN000;; Is this character DBCS?
 38537 00005CD2 730B                    	jnc	short $MIF392
 38538 00005CD4 88C1                    	mov	cl,al				;;AN000;; Save first character
 38539 00005CD6 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl				;;AN001;; Get back function
 38540 00005CD8 CD21                    	int	21h				;;AN000;; Get keyboard input
 38541 00005CDA 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl				;;AN000;; Retrieve first character AX = xxxx
 38542 00005CDC F8                      	clc					;;AN000;; Clear carry condition
 38543 00005CDD EB02                    	jmp	short $MEN392
 38544                                  $MIF392:
 38545 00005CDF B400                    	mov	ah,0				;;AN000;; AX = 00xx where xx is SBCS
 38546                                  $MEN392:
 38547                                  $MIF391:
 38548                                  	;jc	short $MIF396 ; 15/06/2023
 38549 00005CE1 5A                      	pop	dx				;;AN000;;
 38550 00005CE2 59                      	pop	cx				;;AN000;;
 38551                                  	;jmp	short $MEN396
 38552 00005CE3 C3                      	retn
