 38566                                  
 38567                                  ;============================================================================
 38568                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 38569                                  ;============================================================================
 38570                                  ; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38571                                  
 38572                                  ;****************************************************************************
 38573                                  ;
 38574                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 38575                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 38576                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 38577                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 38578                                  ;
 38579                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 38580                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 38581                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 38582                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 38583                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 38584                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 38585                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 38586                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 38587                                  ; available during the load.
 38588                                  ;
 38589                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 38590                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 38591                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 38592                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 38593                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 38594                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 38595                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 38596                                  ;
 38597                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 38598                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 38599                                  ; the command-line.  The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 38600                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 38601                                  ; UMB.  Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 38602                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load.  Note
 38603                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 38604                                  ;
 38605                                  ;****************************************************************************
 38606                                  
 38607                                  ;___PROCEDURES_______________________________________________________________
 38608                                  ;
 38609                                  ;   AddrToUmb   - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB #
 38610                                  ;   BigFree     - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 38611                                  ;   FixMem      - scans the UM chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 38612                                  ;   FreezeUM    - Marks FROZEN all UM elements now FREE, save those in load UMB
 38613                                  ;   GetLoadSize - Returns the load UMB minimum size (0 if not specified)
 38614                                  ;   GetLoadUMB  - Returns the load UMB number in AL (-1 if not specified)
 38615                                  ;   GetSize     - Returns the UMB in AL's minimum size (0 if not specified)
 38616                                  ;   GetXNum     - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 38617                                  ;   HideUMBs    - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 38618                                  ;   InitVar     - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 38619                                  ;   NextMCB     - moves an MCB pointer forward to the next MCB
 38620                                  ;   ParseVar    - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 38621                                  ;   PrTable     - produces a printout of the variables in highvar.inc
 38622                                  ;   StoLoadSize - Overrides the load UMB minimum size with what's in AX
 38623                                  ;   StoLoadUMB  - Overrides the load UMB number with what's in AL
 38624                                  ;   UmbHead     - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 38625                                  ;   UnFreeze    - Marks FROZEN elements as FREE
 38626                                  ;
 38627                                  ;___VARIABLES________________________________________________________________
 38628                                  ;
 38629                                  ;   gnradix     - After a call to GetXNum, is 16 or 10, depending on the # read
 38630                                  ;
 38631                                  ;   Internal:
 38632                                  ;___PROCEDURES_______________________________________________________________
 38633                                  ;
 38634                                  ;   convUMB     - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 38635                                  ;   findUMB     - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 38636                                  ;   fm_link     - links UMBs not already linked in
 38637                                  ;   fm_unlink   - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 38638                                  ;   frezMCB     - marks as 8+FROZEN the MCB at ES:0
 38639                                  ;   hideMCB     - marks as HIDDEN the MCB at ES:0
 38640                                  ;   hideUMB     - marks as HIDDEN all FREE elements in UMB passed as AL
 38641                                  ;   hideUMB?    - hides as appropriate the UMB in CL
 38642                                  ;   hl_unlink   - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0; restores strategy too
 38643                                  ;   incArgc     - increments fm_argc, for use with LH command-line parsing
 38644                                  ;   isEOL       - returns with ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 38645                                  ;   isFreeMCB   - returns with ZF set if current MCB (ES:0) is FREE
 38646                                  ;   isFrozMCB   - returns with ZF set if current MCB (ES:0) is FROZEN
 38647                                  ;   isSpecified - sets ZF if UMB in AL wasn't specified in DH/LH line.
 38648                                  ;   isSysMCB    - sets ZF iff ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 38649                                  ;   isTiny      - returns with ZF set if user didn't specify /S
 38650                                  ;   isWhite     - returns with ZF set iff AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 38651                                  ;   loadLow     - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 38652                                  ;   mul32       - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 38653                                  ;   parseL      - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 38654                                  ;   setUMBs     - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 38655                                  ;   shrinkMCB   - breaks an MCB into two pieces, the lowest one's size==AX
 38656                                  ;   stowSiz     - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 38657                                  ;   stowUMB     - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 38658                                  ;   toDigit     - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 38659                                  ;   toPara      - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only
 38660                                  ;   toUpper     - accepts one argument (probly a register), and upper-cases it.
 38661                                  ;   unHideMCB   - marks as FREE the MCB at ES:0
 38662                                  ;   unMarkUMB   - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 38663                                  ;
 38664                                  ;****************************************************************************
 38665                                  
 38666                                  ;DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY equ 5800h ; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 38667                                  ;DOS_SET_STRATEGY   equ 5801h ; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 38668                                  ;DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK  equ 5802h ; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 38669                                  ;DOS_SET_UMBLINK    equ 5803h ; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 38670                                  ;DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS  equ   52h ; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 38671                                  ;DOS_UMB_HEAD       equ   8Ch ; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 38672                                  
 38673                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38674                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 38675                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38676                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 38677                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 38678                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 38679                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 38680                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38681                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 38682                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 38683                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38684                                  
 38685                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38686                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:615Fh
 38687                                  
 38688                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 38689                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5FDCh
 38690                                  InitVar:	; proc	near
 38691                                  	;push	ax
 38692                                  	;push	cx
 38693                                  	;push	di
 38694 00005CE4 06                      	push	es ; * es = ds
 38695 00005CE5 8E06[F59B]              	mov	es,[RESSEG]		;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 38696 00005CE9 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 38697                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 38698                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 38699 00005CEB 26A3[3005]              	mov	[es:fInHigh],ax ; 16/06/2023
 38700 00005CEF 26A3[3205]              	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 38701 00005CF3 26C606[3405]FF          	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],0FFh	;UNSPECIFIED
 38702                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 38703 00005CF9 26A2[3705]              	mov	[es:fm_argc],al		;Start with zero args having been read
 38704                                  
 38705 00005CFD FC                      	cld
 38706                                  
 38707 00005CFE B91000                  	mov	cx,16 ; MAXUMB		;For each entry
 38708 00005D01 BF[5E04]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 38709 00005D04 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 38710                                  
 38711                                  	;mov	cx,16 ; MAXUMB		;Okay... for each entry
 38712 00005D06 B110                    	mov	cl,16
 38713 00005D08 BF[6E04]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 38714 00005D0B F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 38715                                  
 38716 00005D0D 07                      	pop	es ; * es = ds
 38717                                  	;pop	di
 38718                                  	;pop	cx
 38719                                  	;pop	ax
 38720 00005D0E C3                       	retn
 38721                                  
 38722                                  ;InitVar endp
 38723                                  
 38724                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38725                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 38726                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38727                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 38728                                  ; EXIT    : None
 38729                                  ; ERROR   : None
 38730                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 38731                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38732                                  
 38733                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38734                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 38735                                  FixMem:
 38736                                  	;push	ax
 38737                                  	;push	bx
 38738                                  	;push	cx
 38739                                  	;push	dx
 38740 00005D0F 06                      	push	es
 38741                                  
 38742 00005D10 E84900                  	call	fm_link			; Link in UMBs
 38743                                  
 38744 00005D13 E82302                  	call	UmbHead			; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 38745 00005D16 723F                    	jc	short fmX		; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 38746                                  
 38747 00005D18 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 38748                                  
 38749                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 38750                                  
 38751 00005D1A 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 38752 00005D1C 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx			; in CX... and the last owner
 38753 00005D1E 42                      	inc	dx			; in dx as we go through the loop:
 38754                                  
 38755                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 38756                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 38757                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 38758                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 38759                                  
 38760                                  fm10:	
 38761 00005D1F 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]	; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 38762                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 38763 00005D23 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:arena_owner]	; if not zero, do nothing
 38764                                  	;mov	bx,[es:1]
 38765 00005D28 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 38766 00005D2A 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 38767                                  
 38768                                  ; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 ---------------------------------
 38769                                  
 38770                                  fm20:	
 38771 00005D2C 268B1E0300              	mov	bx,[es:arena_size]	; Grab this block's Size,
 38772                                  	;mov	bx,[es:3]
 38773 00005D31 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 38774 00005D33 26A20000                	mov	[es:arena_signature], al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 38775                                  	;mov	[es:0],al
 38776                                  
 38777 00005D37 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:arena_size]	; Size += first MCB's size
 38778                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 38779 00005D3C 43                      	inc	bx
 38780 00005D3D 26891E0300              	mov	[es:arena_size],bx	; Write the size
 38781                                  
 38782                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 38783                                  fm30:	
 38784 00005D42 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 38785 00005D44 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:arena_owner]	; And remember its owner
 38786                                  	;mov	dx,[es:1]
 38787                                  
 38788                                  	;NextMCB es,bx			; Move to the next MCB
 38789                                  	
 38790 00005D49 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 38791                                  	;add	bx,[es:3]
 38792 00005D4B 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:arena_size]
 38793 00005D50 43                      	inc	bx
 38794 00005D51 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 38795                                  
 38796                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'	; cmp al,5Ah
 38797 00005D53 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 38798 00005D55 75C8                    	jnz	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 38799                                  fmX:	
 38800 00005D57 E81900                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 38801                                  
 38802 00005D5A 07                      	pop	es
 38803                                  	;pop	dx
 38804                                  	;pop	cx
 38805                                  	;pop	bx
 38806                                  	;pop	ax
 38807 00005D5B C3                      	retn
 38808                                  
 38809                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38810                                  ; 16/06/2023
 38811                                  
 38812                                  ;INT 21h - DOS 5+ - GET OR SET UMB LINK STATE
 38813                                  ; .......................................................
 38814                                  ;     AH = 58h
 38815                                  ;     AL = subfunction
 38816                                  ;	02h get UMB link state
 38817                                  ;	    Return:
 38818                                  ;		AL = current link state
 38819                                  ;		  00h - UMBs not part of DOS memory chain
 38820                                  ;		  01h - UMBs in DOS memory chain
 38821                                  ;	03h set UMB link state
 38822                                  ;	    BX = new link state
 38823                                  ;		0000h - remove UMBs from DOS memory chain
 38824                                  ;		0001h - add UMBs to DOS memory chain
 38825                                  ;
 38826                                  ;Return: CF clear if successful
 38827                                  ;	CF set on error
 38828                                  ;	AX = error code (01h) (see #01680)
 38829                                  ; .......................................................
 38830                                  
 38831                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38832                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 38833                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38834                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 38835                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 38836                                  ; ERROR:    None
 38837                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 38838                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38839                                  
 38840                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38841                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 38842                                  fm_link:
 38843 00005D5C B80258                  	mov	ax,5802h ; DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK
 38844 00005D5F CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 38845                                  
 38846                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 38847                                  
 38848                                  	;push	es
 38849                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 38850                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 38851                                  	;pop	es
 38852 00005D61 1E                      	push	ds
 38853 00005D62 8E1E[F59B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 38854 00005D66 A2[3505]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 38855 00005D69 1F                      	pop	ds
 38856                                  
 38857 00005D6A B80358                  	mov	ax,5803h ; DOS_SET_UMBLINK
 38858 00005D6D BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 38859 00005D70 CD21                    	int	21h
 38860 00005D72 C3                      	retn
 38861                                  
 38862                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38863                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 38864                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38865                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 38866                                  ; EXIT:     None
 38867                                  ; ERROR:    None
 38868                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 38869                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38870                                  
 38871                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38872                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 38873                                  fm_unlink:
 38874 00005D73 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 38875                                  	
 38876                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 38877                                  
 38878 00005D75 1E                      	push    ds
 38879 00005D76 8E1E[F59B]              	mov     ds,[RESSEG]
 38880 00005D7A 8A1E[3505]              	mov     bl,[fm_umb]
 38881 00005D7E 1F                      	pop     ds
 38882                                  	
 38883 00005D7F B80358                  	mov	ax,5803h ; DOS_SET_UMBLINK
 38884 00005D82 CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 38885 00005D84 C3                      	retn
 38886                                  
 38887                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38888                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 38889                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 38890                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38891                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 38892                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 38893                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 38894                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 38895                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38896                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 38897                                  ;
 38898                                  
 38899                                  ;PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 38900                                  ;PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 38901                                  ;PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 38902                                  
 38903                                  ;
 38904                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 38905                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 38906                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 38907                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 38908                                  ;
 38909                                  
 38910                                  ;optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 38911                                  ;optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 38912                                  
 38913                                  ;
 38914                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38915                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 38916                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 38917                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 38918                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 38919                                  ;     lh
 38920                                  ;     /l
 38921                                  ;     1
 38922                                  ;     1000
 38923                                  ;     2
 38924                                  ;     print
 38925                                  ;     /d
 38926                                  ;     :lpt2
 38927                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 38928                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 38929                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 38930                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 38931                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 38932                                  ; for:
 38933                                  ;    Each /L
 38934                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 38935                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 38936                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 38937                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 38938                                  ; "print". Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 38939                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38940                                  
 38941                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38942                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6216h
 38943                                  
 38944                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 38945                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6093h
 38946                                  
 38947                                  ParseVar:	; proc	near
 38948                                  	;push	di
 38949                                  	;push	ds ; *
 38950                                  	;push	es
 38951                                  	;
 38952                                  	; 16/06/2023
 38953                                  	; es = ds (from 'ParseLhCmd')
 38954                                  	;push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 38955                                  	;pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 38956                                  	
 38957 00005D85 FC                      	cld
 38958                                  
 38959                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 38960                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 38961                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 38962                                  
 38963                                  pv10:	
 38964 00005D86 AC                      	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 38965 00005D87 E8A800                  	call	isWhite
 38966 00005D8A 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 38967 00005D8C 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/' ; SWTCH
 38968 00005D8E 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 38969                                  
 38970 00005D90 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 38971 00005D91 F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 38972 00005D92 EB2C                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 38973                                  pv20:
 38974 00005D94 AC                      	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 38975                                  
 38976                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 38977 00005D95 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 38978                                  
 38979 00005D97 3C53                    	cmp	al,'S' ; optS	; just read 'S'?
 38980 00005D99 7510                    	jne	short pv30
 38981                                  
 38982 00005D9B E87E00                  	call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 38983                                  
 38984                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 38985                                  
 38986                                  	;push	es
 38987                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 38988                                  	;mov	byte [es:fUmbTiny],1
 38989                                  	;pop	es
 38990 00005D9E 1E                      	push	ds
 38991 00005D9F 8E1E[F59B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 38992 00005DA3 C606[3105]01            	mov	byte [fUmbTiny],1
 38993 00005DA8 1F                      	pop	ds
 38994                                  
 38995 00005DA9 EBDB                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 38996                                  pv30:	
 38997 00005DAB 3C4C                    	cmp	al,'L' ; optL	; If it's not 'L' either, then it's a bad
 38998 00005DAD 750B                    	jne	short pvE1	; switch!
 38999                                  
 39000 00005DAF E86A00                  	call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 39001                                  
 39002 00005DB2 E80C00                  	call	parseL
 39003 00005DB5 73CF                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 39004                                  
 39005 00005DB7 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 39006 00005DB8 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 39007                                  pvE1:	
 39008 00005DBA B80300                  	mov	ax,3 ; PV_InvSwt
 39009                                  				; Unrecognized switch passed
 39010                                  pvErr:
 39011 00005DBD 4E                      	dec	si
 39012 00005DBE 4E                      	dec	si
 39013 00005DBF F9                      	stc
 39014                                  pvX:	
 39015                                  	;pop	es
 39016                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 39017                                  	;pop	di
 39018 00005DC0 C3                      	retn
 39019                                  
 39020                                  ;ParseVar endp
 39021                                  
 39022                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39023                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 39024                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39025                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 39026                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 39027                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 39028                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 39029                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39030                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 39031                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 39032                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 39033                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 39034                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39035                                  
 39036                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39037                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39038                                  parseL:
 39039 00005DC1 AC                      	lodsb
 39040 00005DC2 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 39041 00005DC4 754A                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 39042                                  
 39043                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 39044                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 39045                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 39046                                  
 39047                                  pl10:
 39048 00005DC6 E8FD00                  	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 39049 00005DC9 724B                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 39050 00005DCB E8C801                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 39051                                  
 39052 00005DCE 88C1                    	mov	cl,al	; !*	; Remember the UMB number
 39053 00005DD0 E88300                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 39054 00005DD3 7241                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 39055                                  
 39056 00005DD5 E84400                  	call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 39057                                  
 39058 00005DD8 AC                      	lodsb
 39059 00005DD9 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 39060 00005DDB 74E9                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 39061                                  
 39062 00005DDD E85200                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 39063 00005DE0 7439                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 39064                                  
 39065 00005DE2 E84200                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 39066 00005DE5 7433                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 39067                                  
 39068 00005DE7 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/' ; SWTCH	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 39069 00005DE9 742F                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 39070                                  
 39071 00005DEB 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 39072 00005DED 7521                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 39073                                  
 39074                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 39075                                  
 39076 00005DEF E8D400                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 39077 00005DF2 721C                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 39078                                  
 39079 00005DF4 E83401                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 39080                                  
 39081 00005DF7 E88600                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 39082                                  
 39083 00005DFA E81F00                  	call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 39084                                  
 39085 00005DFD AC                      	lodsb
 39086 00005DFE 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 39087 00005E00 74C4                    	je	short pl10		;
 39088                                  
 39089 00005E02 E82D00                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 39090 00005E05 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 39091                                  
 39092 00005E07 E81D00                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 39093 00005E0A 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 39094                                  
 39095 00005E0C 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/' ; SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 39096 00005E0E 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 39097                                  plE1:	
 39098 00005E10 B80100                  	mov	ax,1 ; PV_InvArg
 39099                                  				; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 39100 00005E13 4E                      	dec	si
 39101 00005E14 F9                      	stc
 39102 00005E15 C3                      	retn
 39103                                  plE2:
 39104                                  	; cf = 1 
 39105 00005E16 B80200                  	mov	ax,2 ; PV_BadUMB
 39106                                  				; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 39107                                  	;stc
 39108 00005E19 C3                      	retn
 39109                                  plSwX:
 39110 00005E1A 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 39111                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 39112                                  plX:
 39113                                  	; cf = 0
 39114                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 39115 00005E1B C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 39116                                  
 39117                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39118                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 39119                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39120                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 39121                                  ; EXIT:     None
 39122                                  ; ERROR:    None
 39123                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 39124                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39125                                  
 39126                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39127                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39128                                  incArgc:
 39129                                  	;push	ax
 39130                                  
 39131                                  	;;getdata al,fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 39132                                  	;
 39133                                  	;push	ds		; getdata (macro)
 39134                                  	;			; getdata al, fm_argc
 39135                                  	;mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 39136                                  	;mov	al,[fm_argc]	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 39137                                  	;pop	ds
 39138                                  	;
 39139                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 39140                                  	;
 39141                                  	;;putdata fm_argc,al	; And store it right back.
 39142                                  	;
 39143                                  	;push	es		; putdata (macro)
 39144                                  	;			; putdata fm_argc, al
 39145                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 39146                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc],al	; and store it right back.
 39147                                  	;pop	es
 39148                                  
 39149                                  	; 16/06/2023

 39158                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39159                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 39160                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39161                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 39162                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 39163                                  ; ERROR:    None
 39164                                  ; USES:     ZF
 39165                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39166

 39256                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39257                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 39258                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 39259                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain.  If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 39260                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 39261                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39262                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 39263                                  ; EXIT:     None
 39264                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 39265                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 39266                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39267                                  
 39268                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39269                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39270                                  stowUMB:
 39271 00005E56 3C10                    	cmp	al,16 ; MAXUMB
 39272 00005E58 7202                    	jb	short su10
 39273 00005E5A F9                      	stc
 39274 00005E5B C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 39275                                  su10:
 39276                                  	;pushreg <bx,di,si,ds,es>
 39277                                  	;dataseg es		; Point ES into appropriate data segment
 39278                                  	;dataseg ds		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 39279                                  
 39280                                  	;push	bx ; **
 39281                                  	
 39282                                  	;push	di
 39283                                  	;push	si
 39284                                  
 39285 00005E5C 1E                      	push	ds ; *
 39286                                  
 39287                                  	;push	es
 39288                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 39289 00005E5D 8E1E[F59B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 39290                                  
 39291 00005E61 803E[3405]FF            	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh ; UNSPECIFIED
 39292                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 39293 00005E66 7503                    	jne	short su20
 39294 00005E68 A2[3405]                	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 39295                                  su20:	
 39296 00005E6B 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 39297 00005E6D 740F                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 39298                                  
 39299                                  	;mov	bl,al
 39300                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 39301                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 39302 00005E6F 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 39303 00005E71 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 39304 00005E73 B001                    	mov	al,1
 39305                                  
 39306                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 39307 00005E75 8687[5E04]              	xchg	[bx+UmbUsed],al
 39308                                  
 39309 00005E79 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 39310 00005E7B 7401                    	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 39311                                  
 39312 00005E7D F9                      	stc			; OOOPS! This one's been used before. :(
 39313                                  su30:	
 39314                                  	;popreg	<es,ds,si,di,bx>
 39315                                  	;normseg ds
 39316                                  	;normseg es
 39317                                  	;retn
 39318                                  
 39319                                  	;pop	es
 39320                                  	
 39321 00005E7E 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
 39322                                  	
 39323                                  	;pop	si
 39324                                  	;pop	di
 39325                                  	
 39326                                  	;pop	bx ; **
 39327                                  
 39328 00005E7F C3                      	retn
