 39370                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39371                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 39372                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 39373                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).  A-F
 39374                                  ; are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 39375                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39376                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 39377                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 39378                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 39379                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 39380                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39381                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 39382                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 39383                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 39384                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39385                                  
 39386                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39387                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6358h
 39388                                  gnradix:
 39389 00005E91 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 39390                                  
 39391                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39392                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:635Ah
 39393                                  
 39394                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39395                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:61D7h
 39396                                  toDigit:
 39397                                  	;cmp	word [gnradix],16
 39398 00005E93 803E[915E]10            	cmp	byte [gnradix],16
 39399 00005E98 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 39400                                  
 39401 00005E9A 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'
 39402 00005E9D 7209                    	jb	short td10
 39403 00005E9F 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'
 39404 00005EA2 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 39405 00005EA4 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 39406                                  ;	clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 39407 00005EA7 C3                      	retn
 39408                                  td10:
 39409 00005EA8 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'
 39410 00005EAB 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 39411 00005EAD 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'
 39412 00005EB0 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 39413 00005EB2 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 39414                                  ;	clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 39415                                  tdErr:
 39416 00005EB5 C3                      	retn
 39417                                  td20:
 39418 00005EB6 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 39419                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 39420 00005EB9 72FA                    	jb	short tdErr ; cf = 1
 39421 00005EBB 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 39422 00005EBE 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 39423 00005EC0 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	  ; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 39424                                  ;	clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 39425 00005EC3 C3                      	retn
 39426                                  tdE:
 39427 00005EC4 F9                      	stc
 39428 00005EC5 C3                      	retn
 39429                                  
 39430                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39431                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 39432                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39433                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 39434                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 39435                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 39436                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 39437                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39438                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 39439                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 39440                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 39441                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39442                                  
 39443                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39444                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39445                                  GetXNum:
 39446                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx,ds>
 39447                                  	
 39448                                  	;push	bx ; **
 39449 00005EC6 51                      	push	cx ; *
 39450                                  	
 39451                                  	;push	ds
 39452                                  
 39453 00005EC7 FC                      	cld
 39454 00005EC8 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 39455 00005ECA 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 39456 00005ECC 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 39457 00005ECE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 39458                                  
 39459                                  	;mov	word [gnradix],10 ; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 39460 00005ED0 C606[915E]0A            	mov	byte [gnradix],10
 39461                                  
 39462 00005ED5 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 39463 00005ED8 E8B8FF                  	call	toDigit
 39464 00005EDB 722D                    	jc	short gxnE	; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 39465                                  
 39466 00005EDD 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 39467 00005EDF 7515                    	jnz	short gxn20	; Doesn't have '0x'
 39468 00005EE1 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 39469 00005EE5 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'		; Either 'x'...
 39470 00005EE8 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 39471 00005EEA 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'		; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 39472 00005EED 7507                    	jne	short gxn20
 39473                                  
 39474                                  gxn10:
 39475                                  	;mov	word [gnradix],16
 39476 00005EEF C606[915E]10            	mov	byte [gnradix],16
 39477 00005EF4 46                      	inc	si		; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 39478 00005EF5 46                      	inc	si
 39479                                  
 39480                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 39481                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 39482                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 39483                                  ;        BX    = 0
 39484                                  ;        CH    = 0
 39485                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 39486                                  
 39487                                  gxn20:
 39488 00005EF6 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 39489 00005EF9 46                      	inc	si
 39490                                  
 39491 00005EFA E896FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 39492 00005EFD 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 39493                                  
 39494 00005EFF E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 39495 00005F02 7206                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 39496                                  
 39497 00005F04 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 39498 00005F06 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 if last add wrapped
 39499                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 39500                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 39501 00005F08 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 39502                                  gxnE:
 39503                                  	; cf = 1
 39504                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 39505                                  	;jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 39506                                  ;gxnQ:
 39507                                  	;dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 39508                                  	;clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 39509                                  gxnX:
 39510                                  	;popreg	<ds,cx,bx>
 39511                                  
 39512                                  	;pop	ds
 39513                                  
 39514 00005F0A 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 39515                                  	;pop	bx ; **
 39516                                  
 39517 00005F0B C3                      	retn
 39518                                  gxnQ:
 39519 00005F0C 4E                      	dec	si
 39520 00005F0D F8                      	clc
 39521 00005F0E EBFA                    	jmp	short gxnX
 39522                                  
 39523                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39524                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 39525                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39526                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 39527                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 39528                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 39529                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 39530                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39531                                  
 39532                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39533                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39534                                  mul32:
 39535 00005F10 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 39536 00005F11 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 39537 00005F13 F726[915E]              	mul	word [gnradix]	; DX=?,      AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 39538 00005F17 7210                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 39539                                  
 39540 00005F19 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 39541 00005F1B 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=0
 39542                                  
 39543 00005F1C 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0,      AX=old:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=new:hi
 39544 00005F1E F726[915E]              	mul	word [gnradix]	; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=new:hi
 39545 00005F22 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=carry
 39546 00005F24 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=carry
 39547 00005F26 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=0
 39548 00005F28 C3                      	retn
 39549                                  m32E:
 39550 00005F29 58                      	pop	ax
 39551 00005F2A C3                      	retn
 39552                                  
 39553                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39554                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 39555                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39556                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 39557                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 39558                                  ; ERROR:   None
 39559                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 39560                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39561                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 39562                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 39563                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39564                                  
 39565                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39566                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39567                                  toPara:
 39568 00005F2B 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 39569                                  
 39570 00005F2C B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 39571 00005F2E D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 39572 00005F30 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 39573 00005F31 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 39574 00005F33 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 39575 00005F35 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 39576                                  
 39577 00005F37 59                      	pop	cx
 39578 00005F38 C3                      	retn
 39579                                  
 39580                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39581                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 39582                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39583                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 39584                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 39585                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 39586                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 39587                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39588                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 39589                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around.  In this event, the pointer
 39590                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around.  On most
 39591                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 39592                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39593                                  
 39594                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39595                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39596                                  UmbHead:
 39597                                  	;pushreg <si,ds,es>
 39598                                  	
 39599                                  	;push	si
 39600                                  	;push	ds
 39601                                  	;push	es
 39602                                  
 39603 00005F39 B452                    	mov	ah,52h	; DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS
 39604                                  					; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 39605 00005F3B CD21                    	int	21h
 39606                                  			; DOS - 2+ internal - GET LIST OF LISTS
 39607                                  			; Return: ES:BX -> DOS list of lists
 39608                                  
 39609                                  	;mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 39610 00005F3D 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:8Ch]
 39611 00005F41 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 39612                                  	;je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 39613                                  
 39614                                  	;clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 39615                                  	;jmp	short uhX
 39616                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39617 00005F44 F5                      	cmc	; cf = 0 <--> cf = 1
 39618                                  uhE:
 39619                                  	;stc
 39620                                  uhX:	
 39621                                  	;popreg	<es,ds,si>
 39622                                  	
 39623                                  	;pop	es
 39624                                  	;pop	ds
 39625                                  	;pop	si
 39626                                  
 39627 00005F45 C3                      	retn
 39628                                  
 39629                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39630                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF iff ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 39631                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39632                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 39633                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 39634                                  ; USES:   Flags
 39635                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39636                                  
 39637                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39638                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39639                                  isSysMCB:
 39640                                  	;push	ax
 39641                                  	
 39642                                  	;mov	ax,[es:1]
 39643 00005F46 26A10100                	mov	ax,[es:arena_owner]	; Check the owner...
 39644 00005F4A 83F808                  	cmp	ax,8 ; SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 39645 00005F4D 7405                    	jz	short ism10
 39646 00005F4F 83F809                  	cmp	ax,9 ; JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 39647                                  	;jz	short ism10
 39648                                  	;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 39649 00005F52 7507                    	jnz	short ismX
 39650                                  ism10:
 39651                                  	;mov	ax,[es:8]
 39652 00005F54 26A10800                	mov	ax,[es:arena_name]	; Check the name...
 39653 00005F58 3D5343                  	cmp	ax,'SC' ; cmp ax,4353h
 39654                                  ismX:
 39655                                  	;pop	ax
 39656 00005F5B C3                      	retn
 39657                                  
 39658                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39659                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 39660                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39661                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 39662                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 39663                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 39664                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 39665                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39666                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 39667                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 39668                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 39669                                  ;      ...
 39670                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 39671                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39672                                  
 39673                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39674                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39675                                  AddrToUmb:
 39676                                  	;pushreg <cx,dx,es>
 39677                                  	
 39678                                  	;push	cx
 39679                                  	;push	dx
 39680 00005F5C 06                      	push	es
 39681                                  
 39682 00005F5D 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 39683                                  
 39684 00005F5F E8D7FF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 39685 00005F62 722B                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 39686                                  
 39687                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 39688 00005F64 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 39689                                  
 39690                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 39691                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 39692                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 39693                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 39694                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 39695                                  
 39696                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39697                                  atu10:
 39698 00005F66 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; *
 39699                                  ;atu10:
 39700                                  	;mov	ax,es
 39701 00005F68 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 39702 00005F6A 7326                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 39703                                  
 39704 00005F6C E8D7FF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 39705 00005F6F 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 39706                                  
 39707 00005F71 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 39708                                  atu20:
 39709                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 39710 00005F72 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]
 39711                                  	;cmp	al,'Z' ; 5Ah
 39712 00005F76 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 39713 00005F78 740A                    	je	short atu30	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 39714                                  
 39715                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 39716 00005F7A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 39717                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]	; NextMCB (macro)
 39718 00005F7C 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:arena_size]
 39719 00005F81 40                      	inc	ax
 39720                                  	;mov	es,ax ; * ; 17/06/2023
 39721 00005F82 EBE2                    	jmp	short atu10
 39722                                  
 39723                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39724                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 39725                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 39726                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39727                                  
 39728                                  atu30:
 39729 00005F84 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 39730                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 39731 00005F86 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:arena_size]
 39732 00005F8B 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 39733 00005F8D 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 39734                                  atuE:
 39735 00005F8F 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 39736 00005F91 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 39737                                  atuX:	
 39738 00005F92 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 39739                                  	
 39740                                  	;popreg	<es,dx,cx>
 39741                                  
 39742 00005F94 07                      	pop	es
 39743                                  	;pop	dx
 39744                                  	;pop	cx
 39745                                  	
 39746 00005F95 C3                      	retn
 39747                                  
 39748                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39749                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 39750                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 39751                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 39752                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 39753                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39754                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 39755                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 39756                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39757                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 39758                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39759                                  
 39760                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39761                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39762                                  convUMB:
 39763                                  	;cmp	word [gnradix],16
 39764 00005F96 803E[915E]10            	cmp	byte [gnradix],16
 39765 00005F9B 7509                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 39766 00005F9D E8BCFF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 39767 00005FA0 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 39768 00005FA3 7501                    	jne	short cu10
 39769 00005FA5 40                      	inc	ax ; ax = 0	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 39770                                  cu10:
 39771 00005FA6 C3                      	retn
 39772                                  
 39773                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39774                                  ;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 39775                                  ;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 39776                                  ; of the usual HIGH_FIRST.  See the code.
 39777                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39778                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 39779                                  ; EXIT:   None
 39780                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39781                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 39782                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39783                                  
 39784                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39785                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39786                                  setUMBs:
 39787                                  	;pushreg <ax,bx>
 39788                                  	
 39789                                  	;push	ax
 39790                                  	;push	bx
 39791                                  
 39792 00005FA7 E8B2FD                  	call	fm_link
 39793                                  
 39794 00005FAA B80058                  	mov	ax,5800h ; DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY
 39795 00005FAD CD21                    	int	21h
 39796                                  
 39797                                  	;putdata fm_strat,al	; Store the current strategy for later restore
 39798                                  
 39799                                  	;push	es
 39800                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 39801                                  	;mov	[es:fm_strat],al ; store the current strategy
 39802                                  	;pop	es
 39803 00005FAF 1E                      	push	ds ; *
 39804 00005FB0 8E1E[F59B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 39805 00005FB4 A2[3605]                	mov	[fm_strat],al
 39806                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 39807                                  
 39808 00005FB7 83E07F                  	and	ax,007Fh	; 0000.0000.0111.1111 == All that other stuff
 39809 00005FBA 50                      	push	ax ; **		; Watch this carefully...
 39810                                  
 39811 00005FBB E80C00                  	call	loadLow		; returns al==0 if load low, al==1 if loadhigh
 39812 00005FBE D0C8                    	ror	al,1		; Shift that to al==0 or al==0x80
 39813                                  
 39814 00005FC0 5B                      	pop	bx ; **		; ...pushed as AX above
 39815                                  	
 39816 00005FC1 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
 39817                                  	
 39818 00005FC2 08C3                    	or	bl,al		; Now we have 0000.0000.?111.1111 in BX;
 39819                                  
 39820 00005FC4 B80158                  	mov	ax,5801h ; DOS_SET_STRATEGY
 39821                                  				; with ? ==1 if load highfirst. Perfect!
 39822 00005FC7 CD21                    	int	21h
 39823                                  
 39824                                  	;popreg	<bx,ax>
 39825                                  
 39826                                  	;pop	bx
 39827                                  	;pop	ax
 39828                                  
 39829 00005FC9 C3                      	retn
 39830                                  
 39831                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39832                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 39833                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39834                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 39835                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 39836                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 39837                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39838                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 39839                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39840                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 39841                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0.  That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 39842                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 39843                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 39844                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39845                                  
 39846                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39847                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39848                                  loadLow:
 39849                                  	;push	ds ; *	
 39850                                  	
 39851                                  	;dataseg ds		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 39852                                  	;mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 39853                                  
 39854                                  	; * ; ds = [RESSEG] from 'setUMBs') ; 17/06/2023
 39855                                  
 39856 00005FCA A0[3405]                	mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 39857 00005FCD 3CFF                    	cmp	al,0FFh ; UNSPECIFIED
 39858 00005FCF 7503                    	jne	short ll10
 39859                                  
 39860                                  	;mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 39861 00005FD1 F9                      	stc
 39862                                  	;jmp	short llX
 39863 00005FD2 EB04                    	jmp	short lly ; 17/06/2023
 39864                                  ll10:
 39865 00005FD4 08C0                    	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 39866 00005FD6 7402                    	jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 39867                                  	; cf= 0
 39868                                  
 39869                                  	;mov	al,1
 39870                                  	;clc	
 39871                                  lly:		; 17/06/2023
 39872 00005FD8 B001                    	mov	al,1
 39873                                  llX:
 39874                                  	;pop	ds ; *		; Return DS to where it was
 39875                                  	
 39876                                  	;normseg ds		;
 39877                                  	
 39878 00005FDA C3                      	retn
 39879                                  
 39880                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39881                                  ;*** HideUMBs - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 39882                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39883                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 39884                                  ; EXIT:   None
 39885                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39886                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 39887                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39888                                  
 39889                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39890                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:64D0h
 39891                                  
 39892                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 39893                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:634Dh
 39894                                  HideUMBs:
 39895                                  	;pushreg <ax,cx,ds,es>
 39896                                  	
 39897                                  	;push	ax
 39898                                  	;push	cx
 39899                                  	;push	ds
 39900                                  	;push	es
 39901                                  
 39902 00005FDB E8EF01                  	call	UmbTest		; See if we REALLY linked in anything...
 39903 00005FDE 7236                    	jc	short husX	; ...if not, there's nothing for us to do.
 39904                                  
 39905 00005FE0 E82CFD                  	call	FixMem		; Concatenate adjacent free MCBs in upper mem
 39906 00005FE3 E8C1FF                  	call	setUMBs		; Link UMBs and set memory-allocation strategy
 39907                                  
 39908                                  	;putdata fInHigh,1	; Remember that we're now running high
 39909                                  	;push	es
 39910                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 39911                                  	;mov	byte [es:fInHigh], 1
 39912                                  	;			; remember that we're now running high
 39913                                  	;pop	es
 39914 00005FE6 1E                      	push	ds
 39915 00005FE7 8E1E[F59B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 39916 00005FEB C606[3005]01            	mov	byte [fInHigh], 1
 39917 00005FF0 1F                      	pop	ds
 39918                                  
 39919 00005FF1 E82300                  	call	GetLoadUMB	; See if they gave us a list to leave free
 39920 00005FF4 3CFF                    	cmp	al,0FFh	; UNSPECIFIED
 39921                                  				; If they didn't,
 39922 00005FF6 741E                    	je	short husX	; then we shouldn't do this loop:
 39923                                  
 39924 00005FF8 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 39925                                  
 39926                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 39927                                  ; HUS10-CX - UMB number (after inc, 1==first UMB)
 39928                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 39929                                  
 39930                                  hus10:
 39931 00005FFA 41                      	inc	cx		; For each UMB:
 39932 00005FFB 83F910                  	cmp	cx,16 ; MAXUMB
 39933 00005FFE 730C                    	jae	short hus20
 39934                                  
 39935 00006000 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; (stopping as soon as we're outside of the
 39936                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39937                                  	;push	es
 39938 00006002 E8A900                  	call	findumb		; valid range of UMBs)
 39939                                  	;pop	es		; push/pop: trash what findumb finds.  :-)
 39940 00006005 7205                    	jc	short hus20
 39941                                  
 39942 00006007 E87901                  	call	hideUMB?	; hide what we need to hide.
 39943                                  
 39944 0000600A EBEE                    	jmp	short hus10
 39945                                  hus20:
 39946 0000600C E80800                  	call	GetLoadUMB	; Now check if they offered /L:0
 39947 0000600F 08C0                    	or	al,al		; --Is the load UMB 0? (-1==unspecified)
 39948 00006011 7503                    	jnz	short husX	; If not, we're done.
 39949                                  
 39950 00006013 E8E701                  	call	hl_unlink	; If so, however, fix UMBs and strategy.
 39951                                  husX:
 39952                                  	;popreg	<es,ds,cx,ax>
 39953                                  	
 39954                                  	;pop	es
 39955                                  	;pop	ds
 39956                                  	;pop	cx
 39957                                  	;pop	ax
 39958                                  
 39959 00006016 C3                      	retn
 39960                                  
 39961                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39962                                  ;*** GetLoadUMB - Returns the load UMB number in AL (-1 if not specified)
 39963                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 39979                                  
 39980 00006020 C3                      	retn
 39981                                  
 39982                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39983                                  ;*** GetSize - Returns the UMB in AL's minimum size (0 if not specified)
 39984                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39985                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == a UMB number
 39986                                  ; EXIT:   AX == UMB minimum size, as specified by the user
 39987                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39988                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX

 39998

 40000 00006022 8E1E[F59B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 40001

 40015                                  	;pop	bx
 40016

 40018 00006032 C3                      	retn
 40019                                  
 40020                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40021                                  ;*** hideUMB - marks as HIDDEN all FREE elements in UMB passed as AL
 40022                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40023                                  ; ENTRY:    AL must indicate a valid UMB; 0==conv && is invalid.
 40024                                  ; EXIT:     None; free elements in UMB marked as hidden
 40025                                  ; ERROR:    None
 40026                                  ; USES:     Flags

 40028                                  
 40029                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM

 40033

 40038 00006036 7221                    	jc	short huX

 40056 00006049 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 40057 0000604B 740C                    	je	short huX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 40058

 40060

 40070

 40116                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40117                                  ;*** hideMCB - marks as HIDDEN the MCB at ES:0
 40118                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40119                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 40120                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB marked as HIDDEN
 40121                                  ; ERROR:    None
 40122                                  ; USES:     None
 40123                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40124                                  
 40125                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40126                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40127                                  hideMCB:
 40128                                  	;mov	word [es:1],8
 40129 0000606F 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:arena_owner],8 ; SystemPSPOwner
 40130                                  	;mov	word [es:8],4948h     ; 'HIDDEN  ' 
 40131 00006076 26C70608004849          	mov	word [es:arena_name+0], 'HI' ; 4948h
 40132 0000607D 26C7060A004444          	mov	word [es:arena_name+2], 'DD' ; 4444h
 40133 00006084 26C7060C00454E          	mov	word [es:arena_name+4], 'EN' ; 4E45h
 40134                                  	;mov	word [es:14],2020h
 40135 0000608B 26C7060E002020          	mov	word [es:arena_name+6], '  ' ; 2020h 
 40136 00006092 C3                      	retn
 40137                                  
 40138                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40139                                  ;*** unHideMCB - marks as FREE the MCB at ES:0
 40140                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40141                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 40142                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB marked as FREE
 40143                                  ; ERROR:    None
 40144                                  ; USES:     None
 40145                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40146                                  
 40147                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40148                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40149                                  unHideMCB:
 40150                                  	;push	ax
 40151                                  	;mov	word [es:1],0
 40152 00006093 26C70601000000          	mov	word [es:arena_owner],0 ; FreePSPOwner
 40153 0000609A B82020                  	mov	ax, '  '  ; mov ax,2020h
 40154                                  	;mov	[es:8],ax
 40155 0000609D 26A30800                	mov	[es:arena_name+0],ax
 40156 000060A1 26A30A00                	mov	[es:arena_name+2],ax
 40157 000060A5 26A30C00                	mov	[es:arena_name+4],ax
 40158                                  	;mov	[es:14],ax
 40159 000060A9 26A30E00                	mov	[es:arena_name+6],ax
 40160                                  	;pop	ax
 40161 000060AD C3                      	retn
 40162                                  
 40163                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40164                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 40165                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 40166                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40167                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 40168                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to first MCB in UMB (_not_ the 8+SC MCB that heads it)
 40169                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (too high)
 40170                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 40171                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40172                                  
 40173                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40174                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40175                                  findumb:
 40176                                  	;pushreg <ax,cx,dx>
 40177                                  	
 40178                                  	;push	ax
 40179 000060AE 51                      	push	cx
 40180 000060AF 52                      	push	dx
 40181                                  
 40182 000060B0 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah		; Zap ah, so al==ax
 40183                                  
 40184 000060B2 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; Store the to-be-found UMB number in DX
 40185                                  
 40186 000060B4 E882FE                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns first UMB segment in AX
 40187                                  
 40188 000060B7 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 40189 000060B9 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now...
 40190                                  
 40191                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 40192                                  ; FU10--CX - This UMB number; 0 == conventional
 40193                                  ;       DX - The UMB number they're looking for
 40194                                  ;       ES - The current MCB address
 40195                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 40196                                  
 40197                                  fu10:	
 40198 000060BB 39D1                    	cmp	cx,dx		; If CX==DX, we've found the UMB we're
 40199 000060BD 741B                    	je	short fuX	; searching for--so exit.
 40200                                  
 40201 000060BF E884FE                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 40202 000060C2 7501                    	jnz	short fu20
 40203                                  
 40204 000060C4 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ SYSTEM, we're in a new UMB.
 40205                                  fu20:
 40206                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 40207 000060C5 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]
 40208                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 40209 000060C9 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 40210 000060CB 740C                    	je	short fuE	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 40211                                  
 40212                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 40213                                  
 40214 000060CD 8CC0                     	mov	ax,es		; NextMCB (macro)
 40215                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 40216 000060CF 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:arena_size]
 40217 000060D4 40                      	inc	ax
 40218 000060D5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 40219                                  
 40220 000060D7 EBE2                    	jmp	short fu10
 40221                                  fuE:
 40222 000060D9 F9                      	stc
 40223                                  fuX:
 40224                                  	;popreg	<dx,cx,ax>	; The address is already in ES.
 40225                                  	
 40226 000060DA 5A                      	pop	dx
 40227 000060DB 59                      	pop	cx
 40228                                  	
 40229                                  	;pop	ax
 40230 000060DC C3                      	retn
 40231                                  
 40232                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40233                                  ;*** BigFree - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 40234                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40235                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 40236                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to largest free MCB in UMB, AX returns its size
 40237                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (0 or too high)
 40238                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 40239                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40240                                  
 40241                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40242                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6624h
 40243                                  
 40244                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40245                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:64A1h
 40246                                  BigFree:
 40247                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx>
 40248                                  	
 40249                                  	;push	bx
 40250 000060DD 51                      	push	cx
 40251                                  
 40252 000060DE E8CDFF                  	call	findumb			; Returns with CF if err, else ES==MCB
 40253 000060E1 7239                    	jc	short bfX		; (would be "jc bfE"; it just does stc)
 40254                                  
 40255 000060E3 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; Segment address of largest free MCB
 40256 000060E5 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; Size of largest free MCB
 40257                                  
 40258                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 40259                                  ; BF10--ES - Current MCB address
 40260                                  ;       BX - Address of largest free MCB so far
 40261                                  ;       CX - Size of largest free MCB so far
 40262                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 40263                                  
 40264                                  bf10:
 40265 000060E7 E85CFE                  	call	isSysMCB		; If we've left the MCB, we're done.
 40266 000060EA 7427                    	jz	short bf30
 40267                                  
 40268 000060EC E879FF                  	call	isFreeMCB		; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 40269 000060EF 750E                    	jnz	short bf20
 40270                                  
 40271                                  	;cmp	cx,[es:3]
 40272 000060F1 263B0E0300              	cmp	cx,[es:arena_size]	; Compare sizes...
 40273 000060F6 7F07                    	jg	short bf20		; Unless we're bigger,
 40274                                  
 40275 000060F8 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Store this new element's address,
 40276                                  	;mov	cx,[es:3]
 40277 000060FA 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:arena_size]	; and its size.
 40278                                  bf20:
 40279                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 40280 000060FF 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]
 40281                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'  ; 5Ah
 40282 00006103 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 40283 00006105 740C                    	je	short bf30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB.
 40284                                  
 40285                                  	;NextMCB es,ax			; Go on forward.
 40286                                  
 40287 00006107 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es 
 40288                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 40289 00006109 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:arena_size]
 40290 0000610E 40                      	inc	ax
 40291 0000610F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 40292                                  
 40293 00006111 EBD4                    	jmp	short bf10
 40294                                  bf30:
 40295 00006113 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx			; Return the address
 40296 00006115 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			; Return the size
 40297 00006117 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 40298 00006119 7501                    	jnz	short bfX		; (if size==0, there's nothing free)
 40299                                  bfE:
 40300 0000611B F9                      	stc
 40301                                  bfX:
 40302                                  	;popreg	<cx,bx>
 40303                                  
 40304 0000611C 59                      	pop	cx
 40305                                  	;pop	bx
 40306                                  
 40307 0000611D C3                      	retn
 40308                                  
 40309                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40310                                  ;*** isSpecified - sets ZF if UMB in AL wasn't specified in DH/LH line.
 40311                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40312                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 40313                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if UMB wasn't specified, ZF clear if it was
 40314                                  ; ERROR:    None
 40315                                  ; USES:     Flags
 40316                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40317                                  
 40318                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40319                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40320                                  isSpecified:
 40321                                  	;push	ax
 40322                                  
 40323 0000611E 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
 40324 00006120 88C3                    	mov	bl,al
 40325                                  
 40326                                  	;getdata al,DS:UmbUsed[bx]
 40327                                  
 40328 00006122 1E                      	push	ds
 40329 00006123 8E1E[F59B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 40330 00006127 8A87[5E04]              	mov	al,[bx+UmbUsed]
 40331 0000612B 1F                      	pop     ds
 40332                                  
 40333 0000612C 08C0                    	or	al,al		; Sets ZF if al==0 (ie, if unspecified)
 40334                                  
 40335                                  	;pop	ax
 40336 0000612E C3                      	retn
 40337                                  
 40338                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40339                                  ;*** shrinkMCB - breaks an MCB into two pieces, the lowest one's size==AX
 40340                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40341                                  ; ENTRY:    AX == new size, ES:0 == current MCB
 40342                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB broken if carry clear
 40343                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if MCB isn't as large as AX+0x20 (not a useful split)
 40344                                  ; USES:     Flags
 40345                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40346                                  ; If the size of the to-be-split MCB isn't at least 0x20 bytes greater than
 40347                                  ; the specified new size, the split is useless; if it's onnly 0x10 bytes, that
 40348                                  ; 0x10 will be used to make a header that mentions a 0-byte free space, and
 40349                                  ; that just sucks up 0x10 bytes for nothing. So we make 0x20 bytes the
 40350                                  ; minimum for performing a split.
 40351                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40352                                  
 40353                                  ;MIN_SPLIT_SIZE	equ 20h
 40354                                  
 40355                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40356                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:667Ah
 40357                                  
 40358                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40359                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:64F7h
 40360                                  shrinkMCB:
 40361                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx,es>
 40362                                  
 40363                                  	;push	bx
 40364 0000612F 51                      	push	cx ; *
 40365 00006130 26                      	psuh	es ; **
 40366                                  
 40367 00006131 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; Move things around... and
 40368 00006133 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; save this one for later.
 40369                                  
 40370 00006135 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:arena_size]
 40371 0000613A 83E920                  	sub	cx,32 ; sub cx,MIN_SPLIT_SIZE
 40372                                  	;cmp	bx,cx			; {New size} vs {Current Size-20h}
 40373                                  	;ja	short smE		; if wanted_size > cur-20h, abort.
 40374 0000613D 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx
 40375 0000613F 723E                    	jb	short smE ; cf = 1 (***)
 40376                                  
 40377                                  	;mov	dl,[es:0]
 40378 00006141 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:arena_signature]
 40379                                  
 40380                                  	;;mov	cx,[es:3]
 40381                                  	;mov	cx,[es:arena_size] ; *!
 40382                                  
 40383 00006146 26891E0300              	mov	[es:arena_size],bx
 40384                                  	;mov	byte [es:0],'M' ; 4Dh
 40385 0000614B 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:arena_signature],'M'
 40386                                  
 40387 00006151 01D8                    	add	ax,bx
 40388 00006153 40                      	inc	ax
 40389 00006154 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; Move to new arena area
 40390                                  
 40391                                  	;mov	ax,cx ; !*
 40392 00006156 26A10300                	mov	ax,[es:arena_size] ; *!
 40393 0000615A 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 40394 0000615C 48                      	dec	ax			; And prepare the new size
 40395                                  
 40396                                  	;mov	[es:0],dl
 40397 0000615D 2688160000              	mov	[es:arena_signature],dl
 40398                                  	;;mov	word [es:1],0
 40399                                  	;mov	word [es:arena_owner],0
 40400                                  	;mov	[es:3],ax
 40401 00006162 26A30300                	mov	[es:arena_size],ax
 40402 00006166 B82020                  	mov	ax,'  ' ; mov ax,2020h
 40403                                  	;mov	[es:8],ax
 40404 00006169 26A30800                	mov	[es:arena_name+0],ax
 40405 0000616D 26A30A00                	mov	[es:arena_name+2],ax
 40406 00006171 26A30C00                	mov	[es:arena_name+4],ax
 40407                                  	;mov	[es:14],ax
 40408 00006175 26A30E00                	mov	[es:arena_name+6],ax
 40409                                  
 40410                                  	;clc
 40411 00006179 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 40412 0000617B 26A30100                	mov	[es:arena_owner],ax ; 0
 40413                                  	; cf = 0
 40414                                  	;jmp	short smX
 40415                                  smE:
 40416                                  	;stc	 ; cf = 1 (***)
 40417                                  smX:
 40418                                  	;popreg	<es,cx,bx>
 40419 0000617F 07                      	pop	es ; **
 40420 00006180 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 40421 00006181 5B                      	pop	bx
 40422                                  
 40423 00006182 C3                      	retn
 40424                                  
 40425                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40426                                  ;*** hideUMB? - hides as appropriate the UMB in CL
 40427                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40428                                  ; ENTRY:    CL should be to a valid UMB number, and AX to its address (findUMB)
 40429                                  ; EXIT:     None; UMB is hidden as necessary
 40430                                  ; ERROR:    None
 40431                                  ; USES:     Flags, AX, CX
 40432                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40433                                  ; PRIMARY LOGIC:
 40434                                  ;
 40435                                  ; If the UMB is specified in the DH/LH statement, then:
 40436                                  ;    If the largest free segment is too small (check specified size), then:
 40437                                  ;       Pretend it wasn't ever specified, and fall out of this IF.
 40438                                  ;    Else, if largest free segment is LARGER than specified size, then:
 40439                                  ;       If /S was given on the command-line, then:
 40440                                  ;          Break that element into two pieces
 40441                                  ;          Set a flag that we're shrinking
 40442                                  ;       Endif
 40443                                  ;    Endif
 40444                                  ; Endif
 40445                                  ; If the UMB is NOT specified (or was removed by the above):
 40446                                  ;    Hide all free elements in the UMB
 40447                                  ;    If the flag that we're shrinking was set, then:
 40448                                  ;       UN-hide the lower portion of the shrunken UMB
 40449                                  ;    ENDIF
 40450                                  ; ENDIF
 40451                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40452                                  
 40453                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40454                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:66D7h
 40455                                  
 40456                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40457                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6554h
 40458                                  hideUMB?:
 40459                                  	;pushreg <bx,dx,es>
 40460                                  
 40461                                  	;push	bx
 40462                                  	;push	dx
 40463                                  	;push	es
 40464                                  
 40465 00006183 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 40466 00006185 E896FF                  	call	isSpecified	; Returns ZF set if al's umb was NOT specified
 40467                                  	;jz	short hu?20
 40468                                  	; 17/06/2023
 40469 00006188 7432                    	jz	short hu?25 ; *
 40470                                  
 40471 0000618A 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the size of the largest
 40472 0000618C E84EFF                  	call	BigFree		; free element in AX; put its address in ES
 40473                                  	;jc	short hu?20	; Oops. Errors mean skip this part.
 40474                                  	; 17/06/2023
 40475 0000618F 723B                    	jc	short hu?X ; **
 40476                                  
 40477 00006191 50                      	push	ax		; TOS==size of BigFree in UMB (popped as BX)
 40478 00006192 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the user's specified
 40479 00006194 E88AFE                  	call	GetSize		; minimum size for this umb (into AX)
 40480 00006197 5B                      	pop	bx		; Now BX==BigFree, AX==Specified Size
 40481                                  
 40482 00006198 09C0                    	or	ax,ax		; If they didn't specify one,
 40483                                  	;jz	short hu?20	; Skip over all this.
 40484                                  	; 17/06/2023
 40485 0000619A 7530                    	jnz	short hu?X ; **
 40486                                  
 40487 0000619C 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		; Ah... if (specified > max free)
 40488 0000619E 7607                    	jbe	short hu?10
 40489                                  
 40490 000061A0 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		;  Then mark that UMB as unused. Nya nya.
 40491 000061A2 E898FC                  	call	unMarkUMB
 40492                                  	;jmp	short hu?20 ; ***
 40493                                  	; 17/06/2023
 40494                                  	; ('isSpecified' would return with ZF=1) ; ***
 40495 000061A5 EB15                    	jmp	short hu?25
 40496                                  hu?10:
 40497 000061A7 E8B0FE                  	call	isTiny		; Returns ZF clear if user specified /S
 40498                                  	;jz	short hu?20
 40499                                  	; 17/06/2023
 40500                                  	; ('isSpecified' would return with ZF=0) ; **
 40501 000061AA 7420                    	jz	short hu?X
 40502                                  
 40503 000061AC E880FF                  	call	shrinkMCB	; They specified /S, so shrink the MCB to AX
 40504                                  	;jc	short hu?20	; Ah... if didn't shrink after all, skip this:
 40505                                  	; 17/06/2023
 40506                                  	; ('isSpecified' would return with ZF=0) ; **
 40507 000061AF 721B                    	jc	short hu?X
 40508                                  
 40509 000061B1 8CC2                    	mov	dx,es
 40510 000061B3 EB09                    	jmp	short hu?30	; Skip the spec check.. we wanna hide this one.
 40511                                  hu?20:
 40512                                  	;mov	al,cl
 40513 000061B5 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 40514 000061B7 E864FF                  	call	isSpecified	; If they specified this UMB, we're done...
 40515 000061BA 7510                    	jnz	short hu?X ; **	; so leave.
 40516                                  hu?25:	; 17/06/2023 ; *
 40517 000061BC 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 40518                                  hu?30:
 40519 000061BE 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 40520                                  
 40521 000061C0 E870FE                  	call	hideUMB		; Hides everything in UMB #al
 40522                                  
 40523 000061C3 09D2                    	or	dx,dx		; Did we shrink a UMB? If not, DX==0,
 40524 000061C5 7405                    	jz	short hu?X	; So we should leave.
 40525                                  
 40526 000061C7 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx		; Ah, but if it isn't, DX==the MCB's address;
 40527 000061C9 E8C7FE                  	call	unHideMCB	; Un-hides the lower portion of that MCB.
 40528                                  hu?X:
 40529                                  	;popreg	<es,dx,bx>
 40530                                  
 40531                                  	;pop	es
 40532                                  	;pop	dx
 40533                                  	;pop	bx
 40534                                  
 40535 000061CC C3                      	retn
 40536                                  
 40537                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40538                                  ;*** UmbTest - returns with carry set if UMBs are not available, else CF==false
 40539                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40540                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 40541                                  ; EXIT:     Carry is clear if UMBs are available, or set if they are not
 40542                                  ; ERROR:    None
 40543                                  ; USES:     CF (AX,BX,DS,ES pushed 'cause they're used by others)
 40544                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40545                                  
 40546                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40547                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40548                                  UmbTest:
 40549                                  	;pushreg <ax,bx,ds,es>
 40550                                  	
 40551                                  	;push	ax
 40552                                  	;push	bx
 40553                                  	;push	ds
 40554                                  	;push	es
 40555                                  
 40556 000061CD E88CFB                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs (if not already linked)
 40557 000061D0 E80600                  	call	WalkMem		; Check to see if they're really linked
 40558 000061D3 9C                      	pushf			; And remember what we found out
 40559 000061D4 E89CFB                  	call	fm_unlink	; Unlink UMBs (if WE have linked 'em)
 40560 000061D7 9D                      	popf			; And restore what we found out.
 40561                                  
 40562                                  	;popreg	<es,ds,bx,ax>
 40563                                  	
 40564                                  	;pop	es
 40565                                  	;pop	ds
 40566                                  	;pop	bx
 40567                                  	;pop	ax
 40568                                  	
 40569 000061D8 C3                      	retn
 40570                                  
 40571                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40572                                  ;*** WalkMem - travels memory chain and returns carry clear iff UMBs are linked
 40573                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40574                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 40575                                  ; EXIT:     Carry SET if MCB chain stops before 9FFF, CLEAR if stops >= 9FFF.
 40576                                  ; ERROR:    None
 40577                                  ; USES:     Flags
 40578                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40579                                  
 40580                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40581                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40582                                  WalkMem:
 40583                                  	;pushreg <ax,bx,es>
 40584                                  	
 40585                                  	;push	ax
 40586                                  	;push	bx
 40587 000061D9 06                      	push	es
 40588                                  
 40589 000061DA B452                    	mov	ah,52h ; DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS
 40590                                  				; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 40591 000061DC CD21                    	int	21h
 40592                                  
 40593 000061DE 268B47FE                	mov	ax,[es:bx-2]
 40594                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 40595                                  
 40596                                  ; ------------------------------
 40597                                  ; UM10: ES = Current MCB pointer
 40598                                  ; ------------------------------
 40599                                  
 40600                                  um10:	
 40601 000061E2 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; *
 40602                                  
 40603                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 40604 000061E4 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]
 40605                                  	;cmp	al,'Z' ; 5Ah
 40606 000061E8 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 40607 000061EA 740A                    	je	short um20	; If signature == 'Z', hay no more.
 40608                                  
 40609                                  	;NextMCB es,bx		; Move to the next MCB
 40610

 40612                                  	;;add	bx,[es:3]
 40613                                  	;add	bx,[es:arena_size]
 40614                                  	;inc	bx
 40615                                  	;mov	es,bx

 40617 000061EE 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:arena_size]
 40618 000061F3 40                      	inc	ax
 40619                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 40620                                  
 40621 000061F4 EBEC                    	jmp	short um10	; And restart the loop.
 40622                                  um20:

 40625

 40627 000061FB 07                      	pop	es
 40628                                  	;pop	bx
 40629                                  	;pop	ax
 40630                                  
 40631 000061FC C3                      	retn
