 40633                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40634                                  ;*** hl_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0; restores strategy too
 40635                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40636                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 40637                                  ; EXIT:     None
 40638                                  ; ERROR:    None
 40639                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 40640                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40641                                  
 40642                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40643                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:681Ch
 40644

 40646                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6699h

 40649

 40651                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb	; Restore original link-state
 40652                                  
 40653                                  	;push	ds

 40656                                  	;pop	ds
 40657

 40659 0000620B CD21                    	int	21h
 40660                                  
 40661 0000620D 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
 40662                                  
 40663                                  	;getdata bl,fm_strat	; Restore original mem-alloc strategy
 40664                                  
 40665                                  	;push	ds
 40666                                  	;mov	ds,[RESSEG]

 40668                                  	;pop	ds
 40669

 40673 00006218 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
 40674                                  
 40675 00006219 C3                      	retn

 40677                                  ;============================================================================
 40678                                  ; LOADHIGH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 40679                                  ;============================================================================
 40680                                  ; 12/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 40681                                  
 40682                                  ; This is a new module added to support loading programs into UMBs provided
 40683                                  ; by DOS 5.0. 
 40684                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40685                                  ; Usage:
 40686                                  ;
 40687                                  ; LOADHIGH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] <filespec>
 40688                                  ;
 40689                                  ; <filespec> has to be a filename that is not wildcarded.
 40690                                  
 40691                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40692                                  ;
 40693                                  ;	Revision History
 40694                                  ;	================
 40695                                  ;
 40696                                  ;	M009	SR	08/01/90	Set flags to indicate that we are
 40697                                  ;				loading and high and also remember
 40698                                  ;				current UMB state.
 40699                                  ;
 40700                                  ;	M016	SR	08/09/90	Give special error message on attempt
 40701                                  ;				to loadhigh batch files and invalid
 40702                                  ;				filename on Loadhigh command line.
 40703                                  ;
 40704                                  ;	M039	SR	11/19/90	Bug #4270. Copy all the whitespaces
 40705                                  ;				after the program name also as part
 40706                                  ;				of the command line being passed to
 40707                                  ;				the program to be invoked.
 40708                                  ;
 40709                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40710                                  
 40711                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40712                                  ;
 40713                                  ;	include highload.inc		; Grab code for ParseVar and such
 40714                                  
 40715                                  iCmdLine	equ	81h		; PSP:81h points to command-line
 40716                                  
 40717                                  ;
 40718                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40719                                  
 40720                                  ;****	LoadHigh -- Main routine for Loadhigh command
 40721                                  ;
 40722                                  ;	ENTRY	Command line tail is at PSP:iCmdLine terminated by 0dh
 40723                                  ;		CS = DS = SS = TRANGROUP
 40724                                  ;
 40725                                  ;	EXIT	None
 40726                                  ;
 40727                                  ;	USED	ax, bx, cx, dx, si, di, es
 40728                                  ;
 40729                                  ;	ERROR EXITS
 40730                                  ;		Message pointers are setup at the error locations and then
 40731                                  ;	we jump back to CERROR which is the transient error recycle point.
 40732                                  ;	Apart from parse errors, the other errors handled are too many
 40733                                  ;	switches anf invalid filenames.
 40734                                  ;
 40735                                  ;	EFFECTS
 40736                                  ;		The allocation strategy and the state of the arena chain are
 40737                                  ;	put in the requested state according to the given options. If a 
 40738                                  ;	filename is also given, it is executed as well.
 40739                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40740                                  
 40741                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 40742                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5927h
 40743                                  
 40744                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40745                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:683Fh
 40746                                  
 40747                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40748                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:66BCh
 40749                                  LoadHigh:
 40750 0000621A 1E                      	push	ds
 40751 0000621B 07                      	pop	es
 40752                                  	
 40753                                  	; 16/06/2023
 40754                                  	;call	SkipLhDelims	; MSDOS 5.0 !
 40755                                  
 40756                                  ;Get command tail to be passed to the program. This includes any whitespace
 40757                                  ;chars between the program name and its parameters as well.
 40758                                  ;On return, ds:si points at the start of the command tail.
 40759                                  
 40760                                  	; 16/06/2023
 40761                                  	;push	si		; MSDOS 5.0 !
 40762 0000621C E81300                  	call	ParseLhCmd
 40763                                  	;pop	si		; MSDOS 5.0 !	
 40764 0000621F 720E                    	jc	short LhErr
 40765                                  	
 40766 00006221 E86500                  	call	SetupCmdLine		;setup pgm's command line
 40767                                  
 40768 00006224 E88700                  	call	SetupPath		;setup path for file
 40769 00006227 7206                    	jc	short LhErr		;file not found
 40770                                  
 40771                                  ;Set allocation strategy to HighFirst and link in UMBs for exec. This will
 40772                                  ;be reset after return from the Exec
 40773                                  ;We will also set a resident flag to indicate that UMBs were activated for
 40774                                  ;the Exec. On return from the Exec, this flag will be used to deactivate UMBs
 40775                                  
 40776 00006229 E8AFFD                  	call	HideUMBs		;prepare upper-memory for load
 40777                                  
 40778 0000622C E9FECA                  	jmp	LH_EXECUTE		;go and exec file ;M051
 40779                                  
 40780                                  LhErr:
 40781                                  ;The error message has been setup at this stage
 40782                                  
 40783 0000622F E9F2CA                  	jmp	cerror			;print error message and recycle 
 40784                                  
 40785                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40786                                  					
 40787                                  ;*** 	ParseLhCmd - parses any command-line options
 40788                                  ;
 40789                                  ;	ENTRY	None
 40790                                  ;
 40791                                  ;	EXIT	Carry clear -- command line parsed successfully
 40792                                  ;		Carry set -- appropriate error message setup
 40793                                  ;
 40794                                  ;	USED	ax, si
 40795                                  ;
 40796                                  ;	EFFECTS
 40797                                  ;		Options set up (see highvar.inc)
 40798                                  ;		Filename to be executed setup
 40799                                  ;
 40800                                  ;	ParseLhCmd calls InitVar to initialize data filled in by ParseVar,
 40801                                  ;	then calls ParseVar itself to actually parse the commmand-line.  On
 40802                                  ;	return from ParseVar, DS:SI will point to the beginning of the child
 40803                                  ;	module's name on the command-line; thus it calls LhCopyFilename to
 40804                                  ;	prepare the command-line for that program.
 40805                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40806                                  
 40807                                  ; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40808                                  %if 0
 40809                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 40810                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5944h
 40811                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 40812                                  	; 11/06/2023
 40813                                  ParseLhCmd:
 40814                                  	;mov	si,81h
 40815                                  	mov	si,iCmdLine	;ds:si points at command line
 40816                                  
 40817                                  	mov	word [COMSW],0
 40818                                  	mov	di,Parse_LoadHi
 40819                                  	xor	cx,cx
 40820                                  	call	Parse_With_Msg
 40821                                  
 40822                                  	; 11/06/2023
 40823                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh ; -1
 40824                                  	;jz	short PLhCmd2
 40825                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 40826                                  	;jnz	short PLhCmd1
 40827                                  	; 11/06/2023
 40828                                  	inc	ax ; cmp ax,-1
 40829                                  	jz	short PLhCmd2 ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 40830                                  	dec	ax ; cmp ax,0
 40831                                  	jnz	short PLhCmd1 ; 1 -> 0
 40832                                  	; ax = 0
 40833                                  
 40834                                  	mov	bx,dx
 40835                                  	; 14/04/2023
 40836                                  	;call	LhCopyFilename
 40837                                  	;; 13/04/2023
 40838                                  	;;;jc	short PLhCmd2  ; !!! jmp short PLhCmd2 !!!
 40839                                  	;;jmp	short PLhCmd2
 40840                                  	;retn
 40841                                  	; 14/04/2023
 40842                                  	jmp	short LhCopyFilename
 40843                                  PLhCmd1:
 40844                                  	stc
 40845                                  PLhCmd2:
 40846                                  	retn
 40847                                  %endif
 40848                                  
 40849                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40850                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6857h
 40851                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40852                                  
 40853                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40854                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:66D4h
 40855                                  ParseLhCmd:
 40856                                  	;assume	ds:TRANGROUP, es:TRANGROUP
 40857                                  	
 40858                                  	;mov	si,81h
 40859 00006232 BE8100                  	mov	si,iCmdLine	;ds:si points at command line
 40860                                  
 40861                                  	; es = ds (from 'LoadHigh') 
 40862                                  	;push	es		;Store ES 'cause we're gonna change it:
 40863                                  
 40864                                  	;push	ds
 40865                                  	;pop	es		;Make sure es:si points to cmd line as well
 40866                                  
 40867 00006235 E8ACFA                  	call	InitVar		;Initialize data for ParseVar
 40868                                  
 40869 00006238 E84AFB                  	call	ParseVar	;And parse the command line
 40870                                  
 40871                                  	;pop	es		;Restore ES now; we're done with it.
 40872                                  
 40873 0000623B 7317                    	jnc	short plcC	;If no error, continue on our way.
 40874                                  
 40875 0000623D 83F802                  	cmp	ax,2 ; PV_BadUMB
 40876                                  				;Bad UMB passed?
 40877 00006240 7505                    	jne	short plc10
 40878                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:LhBadUMB_Ptr
 40879 00006242 BA[D292]                	mov	dx,LhBadUMB_Ptr
 40880 00006245 F9                      	stc
 40881 00006246 C3                      	retn
 40882                                  plc10:	
 40883                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:LhInvSwt_Ptr
 40884 00006247 BA[CF92]                	mov	dx,LhInvSwt_Ptr
 40885 0000624A 83F803                  	cmp	ax,3 ; PV_InvSwt
 40886                                  				;Unrecognized switch passed?
 40887 0000624D 7403                    	je	short plc20
 40888                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:LhInvArg_Ptr
 40889 0000624F BA[C992]                	mov	dx,LhInvArg_Ptr
 40890                                  plc20:
 40891 00006252 F9                      	stc
 40892 00006253 C3                      	retn
 40893                                  plcC:
 40894                                  	;call	LhCopyFilename	;copy filename into our buffer
 40895                                  	;retn			;Return-- carry=status
 40896                                  	; 16/06/2023
 40897                                  	;jmp	short LhCopyFilename
 40898                                  
 40899                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40900                                  
 40901                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 40902

 40911                                  ;set_strategy:

 40931                                  
 40932                                  ;***	LhCopyFilename -- copy filename from command line to buffer
 40933                                  ;
 40934                                  ;	ENTRY	ds:si points at primary argument (filename)
 40935                                  ;
 40936                                  ;	EXIT	Carry set -- filename has wildcards. In this event, DX will
 40937                                  ;				already contain an appropriate error number.
 40938                                  ;		Carry clear -- filename has been copied as needed; DS:SI
 40939                                  ;				points to first character (most likely space)
 40940                                  ;				after filename.
 40941                                  ;
 40942                                  ;	USED	ax, si
 40943                                  ;
 40944                                  ;	EFFECTS
 40945                                  ;		ExecPath contains the filename
 40946                                  ;
 40947                                  ; If there are any wildcards in the filename, then we have an error
 40948                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40949                                  
 40950                                  ; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40951                                  %if 0
 40952                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 40953                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5984h
 40954                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 40955                                  LhCopyFilename:
 40956                                  	push	ds
 40957                                  	push	si
 40958                                  	push	di
 40959                                  	lds	si,[bx+4]
 40960                                  	mov	di,EXECPATH
 40961                                  lhcpfn1:
 40962                                  	lodsb
 40963                                  	cmp	al,2Ah ; '*'
 40964                                  	jz	short lhfilerr
 40965                                  	cmp	al,3Fh ; '?'
 40966                                  	jz	short lhfilerr
 40967                                  	stosb
 40968                                  	or	al,al
 40969                                  	jnz	short lhcpfn1
 40970                                  	; 14/04/2023
 40971                                  	; cf = 0
 40972                                  	;clc
 40973                                  lhfilerr2:
 40974                                  	pop	di
 40975                                  	pop	si
 40976                                  	pop	ds
 40977                                  	retn
 40978                                  lhfilerr:
 40979                                  	mov	dx,LhInvFil_Ptr
 40980                                  	stc
 40981                                  	jmp	short lhfilerr2
 40982                                  
 40983                                  %endif
 40984                                  
 40985                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40986                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6881h
 40987                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40988                                  
 40989                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 40990                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:66FEh
 40991                                  LhCopyFilename:
 40992                                  	;assume	ds:TRANGROUP, es:TRANGROUP
 40993                                  
 40994                                  	;mov	di,offset TRANGROUP:ExecPath
 40995 00006254 BF[1D9B]                	mov	di,EXECPATH
 40996                                  
 40997                                  	;mov	cx,0	; Copied zero characters
 40998 00006257 29C9                    	sub	cx,cx
 40999                                  ;@@:
 41000                                  lhcpfn1:
 41001 00006259 AC                      	lodsb
 41002 0000625A 3C2A                    	cmp	al,'*'			;wildcard?
 41003 0000625C 7421                    	je	short lhfilerr		;yes, error
 41004 0000625E 3C3F                    	cmp	al,'?'			;wildcard?
 41005 00006260 741D                    	je	short lhfilerr		;yes, error
 41006                                  
 41007 00006262 3C0D                    	cmp	al,0Dh			;carriage return?
 41008                                  	;jz	@f
 41009 00006264 7410                    	je	short lhcpfn2
 41010 00006266 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/' ; SwitChar	;'/'?
 41011                                  	;jz	@f
 41012 00006268 740C                    	je	short lhcpfn2
 41013 0000626A 08C0                    	or	al,al			;EOS?
 41014                                  	;jz	@f
 41015 0000626C 7408                    	jz	short lhcpfn2
 41016 0000626E 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '			;Space?
 41017                                  	;jz	@f
 41018 00006270 7404                    	je	short lhcpfn2
 41019                                  	
 41020                                  	;or	al,al
 41021                                  	;;jz	@f
 41022                                  	;je	short lhcpfn2	
 41023                                  
 41024 00006272 AA                      	stosb				;store char
 41025 00006273 41                      	inc	cx			;And remember that we did one more
 41026                                  	;jmp	short @b
 41027 00006274 EBE3                    	jmp	short lhcpfn1
 41028                                  ;@@:
 41029                                  lhcpfn2:
 41030 00006276 30C0                    	xor	al,al			;Indicate EOS reached
 41031 00006278 AA                      	stosb				;store char
 41032                                  
 41033 00006279 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;If we didn't copy any characters,
 41034 0000627B 7407                    	jz	short lhmissing	; they didn't give a filename.
 41035                                  
 41036 0000627D 4E                      	dec	si			;Move back to the delimiting character
 41037                                  	; cf = 0
 41038                                  	;clc				;And indicate no error occurred
 41039 0000627E C3                      	retn
 41040                                  lhfilerr:
 41041                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:LhInvFil_Ptr
 41042 0000627F BA[C392]                	mov	dx,LhInvFil_Ptr		;"Invalid Filename" ; M016
 41043 00006282 F9                      	stc
 41044 00006283 C3                      	retn
 41045                                  lhmissing:
 41046                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:ReqParmMiss
 41047 00006284 BA[CC92]                	mov	dx,ReqParmMiss		;"Required parm missing"
 41048 00006287 F9                      	stc
 41049 00006288 C3                      	retn
 41050                                  
 41051                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41052                                  	
 41053                                  ; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.22) COMMAND.COM 
 41054                                  %if 0
 41055                                  	; 14/04/2023
 41056                                  	; 13/04/2023
 41057                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only !
 41058                                  	; (Procedure name is not from original Microsoft source code!)
 41059                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:596Ah
 41060                                  set_strategy:
 41061                                  	mov	ax,5800h	; DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY
 41062                                  	int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET/SET MEMORY ALLOCATION STRATEGY
 41063                                  			; AL = function code: get allocation strategy
 41064                                  	mov	bx,ax

 41067                                  	int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET/SET MEMORY ALLOCATION STRATEGY
 41068                                  			; AL = function code: set allocation strategy
 41069                                  	retn
 41070

 41072                                  
 41073                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM

 41096                                  ;***	SetupCmdLine -- prepare command line for the program
 41097                                  ;
 41098                                  ;	ENTRY	{es/ds}:si = points just after the end of the child program
 41099                                  ;
 41100                                  ;	EXIT	None
 41101                                  ;
 41102                                  ;	USED
 41103                                  ;
 41104                                  ;	EFFECTS		
 41105                                  ;		The rest of the command line following the pgm name is 
 41106                                  ;	moved to the top of the command line buffer (at TRANGROUP:81h)
 41107                                  ;	and a new command line length is put in
 41108                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41109                                  
 41110                                  	; 14/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 41111                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:59BEh
 41112                                  
 41113                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 41114                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:68BEh
 41115                                  
 41116                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 41117                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:673Bh
 41118                                  SetupCmdLine:
 41119                                  	;mov	di,81h
 41120 00006289 BF8100                  	mov	di,iCmdLine
 41121 0000628C 30C9                    	xor	cl,cl
 41122 0000628E FEC9                    	dec	cl			;just CR means count = 0
 41123                                  SetCmdL1:
 41124 00006290 AC                      	lodsb
 41125 00006291 AA                      	stosb
 41126 00006292 FEC1                    	inc	cl			;update count
 41127                                  	
 41128                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 41129                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 41130                                  	; 14/04/2023
 41131                                  	; * ; MSDOS 6.0 only !
 41132 00006294 08C0                    	or	al,al	; *
 41133 00006296 7404                    	jz	short SetCmdL2 ; *
 41134                                  	
 41135 00006298 3C0D                    	cmp	al,0Dh			;carriage return?

 41137                                  SetCmdL2:
 41138 0000629C 26880E8000              	mov	[es:80h],cl		;store new cmd line length
 41139 000062A1 C3                      	retn
 41140                                  
 41141                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41142                                  
 41143                                  ;***	LhSetupErrMsg -- Sets up error messages
 41144                                  ;
 41145                                  ;	ENTRY	ax = error message number
 41146                                  ;
 41147                                  ;	EXIT	None
 41148                                  ;
 41149                                  ;	USED	dx
 41150                                  ;
 41151                                  ;	EFFECTS
 41152                                  ;		Everything setup to display error message
 41153                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41154                                  	
 41155                                  	; 14/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 41156                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 41157                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 41158                                  LhSetupErrMsg:
 41159 000062A2 C606[D58F]01            	mov	byte [msg_disp_class],ext_msg_class ; 1
 41160 000062A7 BA[D78F]                	mov	dx,extend_buf_ptr
 41161 000062AA A3[D78F]                	mov	[extend_buf_ptr],ax
 41162 000062AD C3                      	retn
 41163                                  
 41164                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41165                                  
 41166                                  ; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.22) COMMAND.COM 
 41167                                  %if 0
 41168                                  	; 14/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 41169                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:59DFh
 41170                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only !
 41171                                  	; (Procedure name is not from original Microsoft source code!)
 41172                                  check_umblink:
 41173                                  	mov	ax,5800h	; DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY
 41174                                  	int	21h 	; DOS - 3+ - GET/SET MEMORY ALLOCATION STRATEGY
 41175                                  			 ; AL = function code: get allocation strategy
 41176                                  	mov	bl,al
 41177                                  	mov	ax,5802h	; DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK
 41178                                  	int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET/SET MEMORY ALLOCATION STRATEGY
 41179                                  			; AL = function code: (DOS 5beta) get UMB link state
 41180                                  	mov	bh,al
 41181                                  	xchg	ax,bx
 41182                                  	rol	al,1
 41183                                  	and	al,1
 41184                                  	shl	ah,1
 41185                                  	or	al,ah
 41186                                  	retn
 41187                                  
 41188                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41189                                  
 41190                                  	; 14/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 41191                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:59F7h
 41192                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 41193                                  HideUMBs:
 41194                                  	push	ds
 41195                                  	call	check_umblink
 41196                                  	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 41197                                  	mov	[fInHigh],al
 41198                                  	or	byte [fInHigh],80h
 41199                                  	pop	ds
 41200                                  	call	set_strategy
 41201                                  	;call	set_umblink
 41202                                  	;retn
 41203                                  	; 14/04/023
 41204                                  	;jmp	short set_umblink

 41209                                  	; 13/04/2023
 41210                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only !
 41211                                  	; (Procedure name is not from original Microsoft source code!)
 41212                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:597Bh
 41213                                  set_umblink:
 41214                                  	mov	ax,5803h	; DOS_SET_UMBLINK
 41215                                  	mov	bx,1
 41216                                  	int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET/SET MEMORY ALLOCATION STRATEGY
 41217                                  			; AL = function code: (DOS 5beta) set UMB link state
 41218                                  	retn

 41221                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41222                                  
 41223                                  ;***	SetupPath -- Do path search for the file to be executed
 41224                                  ;
 41225                                  ;	ENTRY	None
 41226                                  ;
 41227                                  ;	EXIT	Carry set if file not found or not executable file
 41228                                  ;
 41229                                  ;	EFFECTS
 41230                                  ;		ExecPath contains the full path of the file to be executed
 41231                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41232                                  
 41233                                  	; 14/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 41234                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5A0Fh
 41235                                  
 41236                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 41237                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:68E3h
 41238                                  
 41239                                  	; 13/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 41240                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6760h
 41241                                  SetupPath:
 41242                                  
 41243                                  ;Juggle around the argv pointers to make argv[1] into argv[0]. This is 
 41244                                  ;because the path search routine that we are about to invoke expects the
 41245                                  ;filename to search for to be argv[0].
 41246                                  ;
 41247                                  ;If our new argv[0] starts with a switcharacter, it's an option... skip right
 41248                                  ;over it by doing the whole move again (smaller, of course, this time).
 41249                                  
 41250                                  	;mov	ax,arg.argvcnt		;total number of arguments
 41251                                  	; 14/04/2023
 41252                                  	;mov	ax,[ARG_ARGVCNT]
 41253 000062AE A1[10A2]                	mov	ax,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 41254                                  
 41255 000062B1 48                      	dec	ax			;less one - skip "LoadHigh"
 41256                                  	;mov	bx,SIZE Argv_ele
 41257 000062B2 BB0B00                  	mov	bx,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11
 41258                                  	;mov	bx,11
 41259 000062B5 F7E3                    	mul	bx			;dx:ax = size of argument lists
 41260                                  
 41261                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS 4.2 COMMAND.COM
 41262                                  	; --------------------------------------
 41263                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 41264                                  
 41265                                  	;getdata cl,fm_argc		;CL = number of arguments to skip
 41266 000062B7 1E                      	push	ds              	; getdata (macro)
 41267 000062B8 8E1E[F59B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 41268 000062BC 8A0E[3705]              	mov	cl,[fm_argc]
 41269 000062C0 1F                      	pop	ds
 41270                                  	
 41271 000062C1 FEC1                    	inc	cl			;Skip one arg, to get over "lh"
 41272                                  
 41273                                  ;Move argv[1]..argv[n] to argv[0]..argv[n-1]. Here, AX == the overall size
 41274                                  ;of the argument lists.
 41275                                  
 41276                                  argloop:
 41277 000062C3 E31B                    	jcxz	argdone			;If we've finished copying args, leave.
 41278                                  
 41279 000062C5 49                      	dec	cx			;One less time we'll go through this.
 41280                                  
 41281 000062C6 50                      	push	ax			;Copy ( size of remaining list ) bytes
 41282 000062C7 51                      	push	cx			;And remember how many args there were
 41283                                  
 41284                                  	; --------------------------------------
 41285                                  
 41286                                  	; 14/04/2023
 41287 000062C8 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			;size to move
 41288                                  
 41289                                  	;mov	di,offset TRANGROUP:Arg	;Copy TO argv[0]
 41290                                  	;mov	di,ARG_ARGV ;mov di,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argv] ; mov di,[ARG]
 41291 000062CA BF[509F]                	mov	di,ARG	
 41292 000062CD 89FE                    	mov	si,di			;
 41293                                  	;add	si,SIZE Argv_ele	;Copy FROM argv[1]
 41294 000062CF 83C60B                  	add	si,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11
 41295                                  	
 41296                                  	; 14/04/2023
 41297                                  	;mov	cx,ax
 41298                                  
 41299 000062D2 FC                      	cld
 41300 000062D3 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			;Move the argument list
 41301                                  	
 41302                                  	;dec	arg.argvcnt		;Fake one less argument, and
 41303                                  	;dec	word [ARG_ARGVCNT]
 41304 000062D5 FF0E[10A2]              	dec	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 41305                                  
 41306                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS 4.2 COMMAND.COM
 41307                                  	; --------------------------------------
 41308                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 41309                                  	
 41310                                  	;sub	ax,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11	;there's one argument we don't copy.
 41311                                  
 41312 000062D9 59                      	pop	cx
 41313 000062DA 58                      	pop	ax			;Restore the size of the arg list
 41314                                  	; 17/06/2023
 41315                                  	;jmp	short argloop
 41316                                  	
 41317                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 41318 000062DB 83E80B                  	sub	ax,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11
 41319 000062DE 77E3                    	ja	short argloop
 41320                                  	; --------------------------------------
 41321                                  	
 41322                                  ; Done moving... argv[0] is now the child program's name, and [1] its first arg
 41323                                  
 41324                                  	; 17/06/2023
 41325                                  argdone:
 41326 000062E0 E8BDD2                  	call	path_search		;look in the path
 41327                                  
 41328                                  ;ax = 0, no file found
 41329                                  ;ax < 4, batch file found -- cant be executed
 41330                                  ;ax = 4,8 => .com or .exe file found
 41331                                  
 41332 000062E3 09C0                    	or	ax,ax			;any file found?
 41333 000062E5 740B                    	jz	short no_exec_file	;no, error
 41334                                  
 41335 000062E7 83F804                  	cmp	ax,4			;executable file?
 41336                                  	;jl	short no_exec_bat	;no, indicate fail ; M016
 41337                                  	;clc
 41338                                  	;retn
 41339                                  	; 14/04/2023
 41340 000062EA 7201                    	jb	short no_exec_bat
 41341 000062EC C3                      	retn 
 41342                                  
 41343                                  no_exec_bat:
 41344 000062ED BA[C092]                	mov	dx,NoExecBat_Ptr	;Setup message ptr ; M016
 41345 000062F0 EB06                    	jmp	short lhsp_errret	;return error; M016
 41346                                  
 41347                                  no_exec_file:
 41348 000062F2 B80200                  	mov	ax,ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 2
 41349 000062F5 E8AAFF                  	call	LhSetupErrMsg		;setup error message
 41350                                  lhsp_errret:				; M016
 41351 000062F8 F9                      	stc
 41352 000062F9 C3                      	retn

 44624                                  ; PARSE BLOCK FOR DIR
 44625                                  
 44626                                  ; The following parse control block is used for the DIR internal command.
 44627                                  ; This command has one optional file specification and several optional
 44628                                  ; switches. Switches, switch values, and the filespec are returned in 
 44629                                  ; PARSE1_OUTPUT.
 44630                                  ;
 44631                                  ; Switches are /a[value], /-a, /o[value], /-o, /s, /-s, /?, /b, /-b,
 44632                                  ; /w, /-w, /p, and /-p. The string values for /a and /o are optional,
 44633                                  ; do not require colons, and are not checked against a value list.
 44634                                  ;
 44635                                  ; Switch /h has been removed from the DIR command	;M008
 44636                                  ; Switch /? is no longer handled internally		;M008
 44637                                  ;
 44638                                  ; A list of pointers to all the switch synonyms is provided here to
 44639                                  ; help identify which switch has been matched.
 44640                                  
 44641                                  	; 15/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM

 45135                                  ;TITLE	COMMAND Transient Uninitialized DATA
 45136                                  
 45137                                  ;The TRANSPACE segment contains variable data that is considered
 45138                                  ;volatile between command cycles, and therefore is not included in the
 45139                                  ;transient checksum area. Contents of these variables MUST be
 45140                                  ;initialized before use, and must not be relied upon from command
 45141                                  ;cycle to command cycle.
 45142                                  ;
 45143                                  ;No constant data values should be stored here.
